One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine.She requests a loan to buy cement, brick, and sand to build a toilet.

With her business profit,Tâm hopes to build a new house, have a successful business, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and sand to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby is a married woman and a mother of three young children from Guindulman, Bohol. She  raises pigs. Ruby asks for a loan to buy animal feed and piglets. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and piglets.

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
José tiene 60 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado, actualmente está casado y su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tienen tres hijos que ya se acompañaron, por lo tanto en el hogar solo viven él y su esposa.  

José se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, fue su padre quien le enseñó este trabajo ya que le ayudaba a trabajar por las mañanas y por las tardes estudiaba, hoy está muy agradecido con su padre ya que gracias  a su aprendizaje en la agricultura ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, para llegar a trabajar donde tiene la milpa, hace un recorrido de 20 minutos a pie, trabaja 6 horas debido a que ya no tiene las mismas fuerzas de su juventud,  ya que antes trabajaba todo el día, hoy trabaja hasta las 12  y regresa a su casa porque en la tarde tiene que ir a recoger las vacas. 

El préstamo que está solicitando será utilizado en la siembra de una hectárea de maíz, para comprar de abono, semilla y veneno. 

Sus propósitos a futuro son poder dejarles a sus hijos un lugar donde construir su casa, comprar 8 vacas lecheras y dedicarse a cuidarlas.
texts.en:
José is 60 years old, was only able to study up to the sixth grade, is now married, his wife does housework, and he has three children who are married, therefore only he and his wife live at home. 

José has worked in agriculture from an early age. His father taught him this work and helped him work in the mornings and study at night. Today he is very grateful for his father, because thanks to his teachings of agriculture, José has been able to support his family. 

To get to work in the corn field, he walks 20 minutes by foot, and works 6 hours because he no longer has the same strength as he did in his youth, when he would work the entire day. Now he works until 12 and returns home because in the afternoon he has to go get the cows.

The loan he is requesting will be used to plant an acre of corn, to buy fertilizer, seed, and herbicides. His goal for the future is to leave his children a place where they can build a home, buy 8 dairy cows, and focus on caring for them.

loans.use: to plant a hectare of corn, and to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and paesticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blouses and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and eggs for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soap, cold water, and drinks for her business,

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman from Guindulman,Bohol. She has three children and earns a living from her sari-sari/variety store selling various goods and items. 

Sarah raises hogs, too. Sarah asks for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Teofreda

texts.en:
Teofreda is a married woman and a mother of seven children from Guindulman, Bohol. 

She runs a sari-sari/variety store business.  Teofreda asks for a loan to buy canned goods, candies, soda, coffee, sugar, soap and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to improve her stock and attract more buyers. 

Teofreda hopes to make her business a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies, soda, coffee, sugar, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish, meat, fufu, rice, palm oil, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Ujang

texts.en:
Ujang lives north of Bogor about two hours from Jakarta. Ujang manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  He is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Ujang joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Ujang sees improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he has earned an average of $25 - 26 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Discipline Group

texts.en:
The members of this group are part of Anteh we group from Teshie-Accra, Ghana. The group is composed of six members who earn their living by selling fresh fish, chicken wings, maize, fruits, plastic bowls, enamel bowls, sauce pans, and buckets. They need additional capital to maintain, enhance or expand their businesses and decided to apply for a loan from ID Ghana. They are excited and full of hope to begin this new loan with solid goals and dreams. 

Philomena is a 45-year-old single woman and has dependent children. In the picture, she is standing third from the left. She completed eight years of formal education, but due to the poor economic condition of her family, had to leave her education behind. Philomena is engaged in the selling of chicken wings and fresh fish. She is applying for her second loan with ID Ghana. The requested funds will be used to purchase chicken wings and fresh fish to sell to her customers. On behalf of her colleagues, Philomena expresses gratitude and appreciation for the support from Kiva investors throughout the world who lend such necessary and vital support.

loans.use: To purchase chicken wings and fresh fish

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Халима занимается продажей овощей на прилавке. Ей 52 года. Она в торговом бизнесе более 10 лет. Халима просит кредит, чтобы увеличить товарооборот средств. Она решила значительно увеличить малый бизнес и расширить точку продажи. Халиме в работе помогает ее подруги и сыновья. Халима мама двоих сыновей. Сыновьям 22 и 20 года. Муж находится в Российской Федерации на заработках. Халима хочет быть более успешной бизнес леди и добиться новых высот. Поддержите Халиму.
texts.en: Halima is 52 and has sold vegetables at a market stand for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan so that she can increase her sales and turnover.  She decided to significantly expand her business. Her friends and her two sons, ages 20 and 22, will help her. Her husband works in Russia. Halima wants to be a successful businesswoman and achieve her high goals. She is grateful for the support.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables in order to increase her inventory and expand her business

loans.name: Oliver's Group

texts.en:
Oliver's group is comprised of 2 hard working women.  Oliver is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Oliver has worked hard to manage her fast food business to sell fried chicken and Irish potatoes. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy Irish potatoes and cooking oil for the business. The loan will help Oliver to generate greater profits and take good care of herself and her parents. Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes  and cooking oil for the business,

loans.name: Mayde

texts.es:
La socia Mayde se dedica al negocio de tienda de multiservicios,la socia vende productos de limpieza,vende relojes entre otros productos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el local donde pueda vender los productos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar relojes,escobillas y baldes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mayde works running a general store.  She sells cleaning products and watches, among other items.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  At this point she has been in this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand the space where she can sell her products.  She is asking for this loan to buy watches, brooms, and buckets.

Mayde is happy because of the loan, and she is committed to making her required payments.

loans.use: to buy watches, brooms, and buckets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, 2 attend school. 

For the past 3 years, Margret has worked hard to manage her retail shop which sells soda, bread, juice, sugar, soap, detergent, cooking oil, eggs and other items. 

To help expand her business, Margret requests a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to  buy soda, bread, juice, sugar, soap, detergent, cooking oil, eggs, and other item.  It will help Margret to generate greater profits and increase her standard of living. 

Margret hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business into a super market. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy soda, bread, juice.sugar, soap, detergent, cooking oil,and eggs.

loans.name: Raina

texts.en:
Raina lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. Raina manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Raina is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Raina joined Ruma one month ago because she found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Raina sees improvements in her shop.  For the last month, she earned an average of $9 - 10 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Clare

texts.en:
Clare is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, 2 attend school. 

For the past 5 years, Clare has worked hard to manage her grinding mill, which grinds coffee. 

To help expand her business, Clare requests a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a second machine for grinding coffee and will help Clare to generate greater profits and target more clients. Clare hopes that in the future she will be able to produce more. 

Clare is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Clare who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy a second coffee grinding machine.

loans.name: Anteh We Group

texts.en:
The members of this group are part of Anteh We group from Teshie-Accra, Ghana. The group is composed of three members who earn their living selling smoked fish, lobsters, crab, octopus, millet and corn. They need additional capital to maintain, enhance, and expand their businesses and decided to apply for a loan from ID-Ghana. They are excited and full of hope to begin this new loan with solid goals and dreams.

Mary is a 56-year-old single woman and has grown-up, independent children. In the picture, she is standing in the middle. She completed five years of formal education, but due to the poor economic condition of her family, had to stop her education. 

Mary sells lobsters, crab and octopus. She is applying for her second loan with ID-Ghana. The requested funds will be used to purchase lobsters, crab and octopus. 

On behalf of her colleagues, Mary expresses gratitude and appreciation for the support from Kiva investors throughout the world who provide such necessary and vital support.

loans.use: to purchase lobsters, crab and octopus.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase reliable and efficient energy for cooking

loans.name: Godius

texts.en:
Godius is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who attend school. 

For the past 4 years, Godius has worked hard to manage his retail shop dealing in kitchen ware. He sells charcoal stoves, frying pans, sauce pans, and buckets. 

To help expand his business, Godius requests 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal stoves, frying pans, sauce pans, and buckets, and will help Godius to generate greater profits and increase his stock. Godius hopes that in the future he will be able to have more income. 

Godius is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godius who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal stoves, frying pans, sauce pans, and buckets.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, 2 attend school. For the past 5 years, Rosette has worked hard to manage her welding workshop which sells metallic doors, windows, and signposts. 

To help expand her business, Rosette requests 3 000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more windows and metal sign posts. It  will help Rosette to generate greater profits and improve the family's standard of living. Rosette hopes that in the future, she will be able to have a better life. 

Rosette is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rosette who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more windows and metal sign posts.

loans.name: Raul De Jesús

texts.es:
Raúl tiene 24 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al cuidado del hogar, tiene un hijo y su suegra vive con ellos.

Raúl se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 10 años, fue con su padre que aprendió el trabajo y le ha servido de mucho para salir adelante, él siembra maíz y maicillo, además estuvo en el cuartel, trabaja como vigilante de una compañía, su rutina de trabajo es un poco cansada, para llegar donde trabaja tiene que tomar un  pick-up para salir a la carretera, luego toma un autobus para llegar a la ciudad, y después un microbús para llegar donde trabaja, en ocasiones para ahorrar se levanta mas temprano para irse en bicicleta.

El préstamo solicitado será invertido para comprar abono, semilla, veneno, y para comprar una novilla.  

Sus sueños son comprar  un solar y construir su propia casa, que su hijos estudien y se preparen académicamente y pocer comprar  10 vacas lecheras
texts.en:
Raúl is 24 years old.  He studied through the sixth grade.  He has a partner; she works taking care of the home.  He has a child, and his mother-in-law lives with them.

Raúl has worked in agriculture since the time he was ten years old.  He learned this type of work with his father, and it has served him well to get by.  He sows corn and sorghum.  Additionally, he was in the army; he works as a security guard with a company.  His daily routine is a little tiring.  In order to get to where he works, he has to take a pick-up to get to the highway, then he takes a bus to get to the city, and then a minibus to get to where he works.  At times, in order to save, he gets up earlier to go by bicycle.

He will use the requested loan to buy manure, seed, and poison, and to buy a heifer.

His dreams are: to buy a plot of land and build his own house, and that his children would study and prepare themselves academically, and to be able to buy ten milk cows.

loans.use: to buy manure, seed, and poison, and to buy a heifer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, onion, oil, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y sobre todo perseverante ya que con 60 años de edad continua trabajando y luchando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de tortillas, dulces y frutas. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y junto a su compañero de vida quien la poya en todo van saliendo adelante y poco a poco  van mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Con el fin de mejorar su negocio y abarcar una mayor porción de mercado ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de pan para tener una mayor oferta y atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
Juana is an enterprising, hardworking, and above all, perseverant woman, because at sixty years old, she keeps working and struggling to improve her living conditions.  For fifteen years she has worked selling tortillas, sweets, and fruits.  This business is her main source of income. Together with her partner, who supports her in everything, they go on getting ahead and, little by little, improving their living conditions.  

With the goal of improving her business and covering a larger market share, she has made the decision to ask for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of a variety of bread in order to have a wider selection and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of sweet breads and French bread to sell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia Sonia se sigue dedicando al trabajo en un hotel,la socia sigue estudiando la carrera de turismo,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años trabajando en un hotel,el sueño de la socia es terminar de estudiar turismo.La socia solicita el credito para pagar las mensualidades de la universidad.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The borrower, Sonia, continues to be dedicated to her job at a hotel. She continues to study towards a degree in tourism. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. She has already worked in a hotel for several years. Her dream is to finish her studies in tourism. 

Sonia is requesting the loan in order to make her monthly payments to the university. She is grateful for the loan and promises to meet her payment deadlines.

loans.use: to make her monthly payments to the university.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Mulyana

texts.en:
Mulyana lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. Mulyana manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit.  Mulyana is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Mulyana joined Ruma one month ago because he found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Mulyana sees improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he earned an average of $21 - 22 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Maryani

texts.en:
Maryani lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. Maryani manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Maryani is married and lives with two persons in the family home.

Maryani joined Ruma one month ago because she found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Maryani sees improvements in her shop.  For the last month, she earned an average of $34 - 35 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Phoeut's Group

texts.en: Phoeut, 57, is a mother of nine children. She lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Rice farming has been the only source for her to earn an income for 12 years. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for her six past loans, which she has successfully repaid. This is the seventh cycle loan for her while her joint borrower is in her second cycle. They are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay plowing fees. She hopes to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: As a result of limited jobs, Geoffrey ventured into a pub business because there were many customers who enjoyed their leisure through drinking. So with limited capital, he started a small pub to earn income to support his family and meet their needs. His three children are now able to go to school and he plans to contsruct a family house to escape the burden of renting. He is hard working.

loans.use: To buy wine

loans.name: Inobatkhon

texts.ru: Инобатхон добрая дехканка маленького городка Турсунзаде.  Ей 46 лет. Она замужем. В браке у нее трое дочери. Воспитанием дочерей занимается Инобатхон сама. Ее муж, как и многие односельчане, находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Инобатхон более трех лет занимается земледелием, на своем орошаемой участке земли выращивает овощи. Она старается, чтобы ее дочери питались здоровой пищей, без химикатов и добавлений. Инобатхон готовиться к ежегодному посеву. Она подготовила землю для урожая, но ей не хватает немного средств для купли семян. Она просит кредит, чтобы приобрести семена и закончить посев. Поддержите Инобатхона.
texts.en: Inobatkhon is a kind communal farmer from the small town of Tursun-zoda. She is 46 years old and married. From her marriage, she has three daughters. Inobatkhon is raising her daughters by herself. Her husband, like many of his fellow villagers, is working abroad in the Russian Federation. For more than three years, Inobatkhon has been practicing crop farming, growing vegetables on her irrigated plot of land. She strives to feed her daughters healthy food without chemicals or additives. Inobatkhon is preparing for the annual sowing season. She prepared the land for planting the crops, but she does not have enough funds to buy seeds. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and finish sowing. Please support Inobatkhon.

loans.use: to buy seeds for sowing crops.

loans.name: Ariyana

texts.en:
Ariyana lives north of Bogor about two hours from Jakarta. Ariyana manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit.  Ariyana is single and lives with six persons in the family home.

Ariyana joined Ruma one month ago because he found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Ariyana sees improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he earned an average of $2 - 3 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Ke Nyomo Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the group called Ke Nyomo. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. This is the second  loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from ID Ghana. With this loan, they will be able to expand their individual businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their families' standards of living.

The featured borrower of this group is Sheila, age 35. She is single and has no dependent child. She sells wigs and children's dresses. She was born in Teshie, a town in coastal Ghana. She attended elementary school and lives in her family's house. 

Sheila has been selling wigs and children's dresses for the past six years. With this loan, she will buy more wigs and dresses to add to her current inventory for sale. This is her second loan with ID Ghana and Kiva. 

They will need a total amount of 1,700 GHS to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more wigs and children's dresses

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза родом из района Кубадиён. Она 27-летняя замужняя женщина, занимающаяся со своей семьей растениеводством. Шахноза, чтобы увеличить бюджет семьи и улучшить жизненные условия решила параллельно начать новый бизнес. Она давно интересуется заняться купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. У нее есть опыт в выращивании скота, так как в их хозяйстве имеются пару коров для нужд семьи. К тому же она уже запаслась кормом для скотин. Шахноза запрашивает кредит для купли 4-х голов голов бычков, чтобы начать бизнес откорм-продажа скота. Естественно в ведении бизнеса ей будет помогать муж. Шахноза верит в успешность бизнеса и ожидает поддержки.
texts.en: Shahnoza is a native of the Qubadiyon District. She is a 27-year-old married woman who practices crop farming with her family. In order to increase her family's budget and improve their living conditions, Shahnoza decided to simultaneously start a new business. She has long been interested in buying and selling cattle. She has experience in raising cattle, as they have two cows at their home for their family's needs. In addition, she already stocked up on livestock feed for the cattle. Shahnoza is requesting a loan to buy four bull calves in order to start her business of fattening up and reselling cattle. Naturally, her husband will help her run this business. Shahnoza believes in the success of her business and awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy four bull calves to start her new livestock raising business.

loans.name: Bibirajab

texts.en: Bibirajab is 26 years old. She is married and has three children. Bibirajab is going to organize her own farming.  She has rented land. Now, she is going to sow potatoes, carrots, onions, etc. Bibirajab took part in the course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization. She learned a lot of new information.  She is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for organizing this new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for her new business

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José tiene 52 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado debido a la situación económica de su familia, es padre soltero,  su pareja los abandono hace 9 años, tiene 4 hijos pero ya todos viven un sus hogares, ahora vive solo en su casa.  

José se dedica a la agricultura desde su infancia, su padre desde muy pequeño le enseñó a trabajar  y eso se lo agradece siempre, pues le sirvió mucho para sacar adelante a su familia, además le gusta cuidar el ganado, él se levanta muy temprano a las 4:00 AM para ordeñar dos vacas, prepara su desayuno, y aprovecha el viaje para llevar su ganado al potrero y se queda trabajando en los cultivos que siembra en lo trabaja 6 horas  y regresa al mediodía para preparar el almuerzo, luego por la  tarde recoge su ganado y se prepara para trabajar un rato mas.  

El préstamo que está solicitando será invertido en la siembra de un de 1 hectárea de maíz, comprar abono, semilla y veneno. 

Sus sueños son tener 10 vacas lecheras y dedicarse solo al ganado, poder comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa, pues hoy vive en lo ajeno.
texts.en:
José is 52 years old. He studied through sixth grade due the financial situation of his family. He is a single father. His partner abandoned them 9 years ago. He has four children but they are all already living in their own homes. Now he lives alone.

José has worked in agriculture since childhood. His father taught him to work from a very young age and he remains always grateful for this as it has served him greatly for supporting his family. He also enjoys caring for livestock. He gets up very early at 4:00 AM to milk two cows and prepare breakfast. He takes advantage of the trip to take his livestock to pasture and stays to work on the crops that he grows. He works six hours and returns at midday to prepare lunch. Later in the afternoon he collects his livestock and prepares to work a while longer.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in sowing 1 hectare of corn, purchasing fertilizer, seed and pesticide.

His dreams are to have 10 milking cows and work only in livestock and to be able to buy a piece of land and build his own house, since he currently lives in someone else's.

loans.use: to sow 1 hectare of corn, purchase fertilizer, seed and pesticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more candy, oil, candles, soft drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, pepper, bitter ball, maggi cube, etc. for  her business.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Don Miguel de 69 años de edad, junto con su esposa tienen una familia muy numerosa conformada por doce hijos, don Miguel logro cursar tercer grado de estudio, por falta de recursos economicos no continuo estudiando; pero con esfuerzo y trabajo a logrado sacar adelante a su familia, uno de sus hijos se fue al extranjero para poder ayudar a la familia economicamente, dos mas se casaron e independizaron los demas aún viven con don Miguel y tambien trabajan, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Don Miguel en el invierno cultiva todos los años 2.82 hectareas de milpa sembrando maiz, frijoles y maicillo y en el verano don Miguel se dedica a la elaboracion de teja en un negocio particular para llevar el pan de cada dia.

Don Miguel comprara materiales de construccion para ampliar su vivienda y mejorar la calidad de vida y comodidad, ya que quiere construir dos habitaciones más para que sus hijos tengan mayor espacio y privacidad.
El sueño de Don Miguel es que cada uno de sus hijos tengan una habitacion individual.
texts.en:
69 year old Don Miguel, along with his wife, has a very large family with 12 kids. Don Miguel studied through third grade but, because of a lack of economic resources, he didn't stay in school. But, with effort and work, he has been able to bring up his family. One of his children went abroad so that he could help the family economically. Two others are married and independent, and the rest still live with Don Miguel and also work. His wife looks after the house. Every year, in the winter, Don Miguel cultivates his 2.82 hectares of land, growing corn, beans, and millet. In the summer he works for a company making tiles in order to put bread on the table every day. 
Don Miguel will buy the construction materials to make his house larger and to improve the family's quality of life and comfort. He wants to build 2 rooms so that his children have more space and privacy. 
Don Miguel's dream is that every one of his children will have their own room.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make his house larger.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sweet potato greens for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more milk, peanuts, sugar, soap and others items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James wants to thank the Kiva lenders for lending to his previous loan which saw an increase in his productivity as a result of the manure that he used. He wants another loan to pay for a piece of land in his neighborhood in order to increase productivity. He is resilient and hardworking.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa does agriculture on a small scale. With the rains now on, Elisa wants a loan so that he can prepare his land early enough so that the rains sink in the ground. He can then be ready to sow. He is enterprising, and thinks that by hiring laborers, he would be creating employment for other people that are jobless. Elisa is hardworking and a social member of the community where he lives. Pictured is Elisa with the UGAFODE credit officer (with a tag).

loans.use: to hire labor.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel comes from Kitongele village in Kiruhura-Ibanda. Ezekiel is 35 years old and married with 4 children. He is a trader and an agriculturalist who primarily deals in coffee growing in his region. Ezekiel also deals in a produce business where he stocks corn and beans and later sells them when the prices go up. He has achieved a lot from this business like being able to pay school fees for his children, provide them with food and also construct a permanent house for his family.

Ezekiel is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more corn that he will hoard awaiting a rise in price. He will also buy fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

Ezekiel’s major challenges are the low price for his produce and pests and diseases which attack his produce due to overstocking. His dream is to be the leading supplier of produce in his region.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo comes from Rugarama Kagazi Kamwenge district. He is married with two children who are both in school. He is a farmer who deals in coffee farming and also has a retail shop where he earns income to provide for his family.

Leo has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy manure and mulch for his plantation. Leo hopes to be the best coffee farmer in the region if given the necessary support. His major challenge is a poor road network to the market and a dry season which affects his yields. Leo is very honest and hardworking.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Oyruzi

texts.ru:
Ойрузи добрая и отзывчивая девушка в возрасте 19 лет. Она с семьей живет на районе Шахритус. В Таджикистане,  в том числе в Шахритусе большинство жителей занимаются сельскохозяйственными деятельностями, в процентном соотношении составляет 60-70% населения. Потому что Таджикистан горная страна, и предприятия и компании находятся только на равнинах, 7% государства. 
   Ойрузи не стала заниматься сельскохозяйственными деятельностями как ее земляки, а выбрала другое ремесло. Она получила в наследство от отца и матери талант гравировщика. Ойрузи гравирует стенки сундуков. На фотографии Вы можете увидеть ее работы. Ойрузи всего 19 лет и она знает свою работу очень хорошо. Сейчас ей необходимы средства для работы, ей надо купить древесину, но для покупки необходимого количество древесины у нее не хватает денег, и она просит кредит.
texts.en:
Oyruzi is a kind and understanding 19-year-old young woman. She lives with her family in the Shahrituz District. In Tajikistan, including in Shahrituz, the majority of residents practice farming - about 60 to 70% of the population. Because Tajikistan is a mountainous country and businesses and companies are only located in the valleys, about 7% of the population works for the government.

Oyruzi didn't take up farming like her countrymen, but chose a different trade. She received the skill of wood carving from her father and mother. Oyruzi engraves trunk walls. You can see her work in the photograph. Oyruzi is only 19 years old but she knows her profession very well. Now she needs to buy wood in order to continue her work, but she does not have enough money to buy the necessary amount of wood, which is why she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy wood for engraving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lorena tiene 37 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado  ya que su familia era de escasos recursos, está acompañada, tiene 5 hijos y solo una estudia, nadie más vive con ellos

Lorena se dedica a atender un molino que tiene desde hace 5 años, antes solo atendía  su hogar, fue una hermana suya quien la indujo a poner el molino, su día comienza a las 5:00 AM para atender a los clientes que llegan al molino y para preparar el desayuno para su familia, terminando su jornada a las 5:00PM pues a esa hora cierra el molino

El préstamo que está solicitando será utilizado para la siembra de 1 hectárea de maíz para lo cual comprará semilla, abono y veneno

Sus sueños son comprar otro terreno para dejarles a cada uno de sus hijos un lugar donde construir su casa, y además le gustaría tener 5 vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
37 year old Lorena only studied through third grade as her family had scant resources. She has a partner and 5 children and only one is in school and nobody else lives with them. 
Lorena runs a mill and has done so for 5 years. Before that she stayed home and it was one of her sisters who persuaded her to open the mill. She starts her day at 5:00am to attend to her clients when they arrive at the mill and to prepare breakfast for her family. She finishes her day at 5:00pm as this is when the mill closes. 
She will use the loan that she is requesting to sow a hectare of corn, for which she will buy seed, fertilizer, and herbicide. 
Her dreams are to buy more land so that each of her children will have a place to build a house and she would also like to have 5 milk cows.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and herbicide to sow a hectare of corn.

loans.name: Manolito

texts.en:
Manolito is a fish vendor from Dimiao, Bohol. He is a married man and has two grown children. Manolito has been selling fish for more than 10 years now.

Manolito is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. With this, he will be able to improve his fishing business, thus augmenting his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: María Bertha

texts.es:
Doña Bertha de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, dos de ellos trabajan y le ayudan a sostener los gastos del hogar, ella trabaja realizando oficios domesticos el trabajo esta a una cuadra de su hogar, tiene seis años de prestar sus servicios en ese hogar entrando a las 7:00 am y saliendo a las 3:00 pm.

El prestamo lo nesecita para construir una habitación, ya que ella aun vive con sus padres por eso quiere apartarse solo con sus hijos.

Doña Bertha sueña con tener su propia casa algun dia y poder amueblarla y gozar de lo propio junto con sus hijos y ya no depender de sus padres.
texts.en:
40 year old Bertha studied until 6th grade. She is a single mother of 4 children, 2 of whom work and help her with the household expenses. She does domestic work one block from her home, and she has been working in this house for 6 years. She starts at 7:00am and leaves at 3:00pm.
She needs the loan to build a room as she still lives with her parents and she wants to have a space for just her and her kids. 
Bertha's dream is to have her own house some day and to be able to furnish it and to likewise enjoy it with her kids and not depend on her parents.

loans.use: to buy materials with which she wants to build a house.

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.ru: Мукарам пекарь, проживающая в районе Исфара. Ей 50 лет. Она занимается выпечкой традиционных лепешек на протяжении 7 лет. Ей в деятельности помогает муж и сын. Это их семейный бизнес и единственный источник дохода. Их пекарня славится вкусными лепешками и вы всегда можете приобрести у них свежие горячие лепешки. Поэтому у них постоянно много клиентов. Мукарам хочет расширить деятельность. Она хочет закупить оборудование по изготовлению теста и с помощью него готовить много теста для выпечки лепешек. Чтобы реализовать цель, Мукарам обратилась за кредитом, на сумму которого собирается приобрести данное оборудование, а также муку и уголь. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Mukaram is a baker who lives in the Isfara District. She is 50 years old. For 7 years, she has been baking traditional lepyoshki (Central Asian bread). Her husband and son help her with this business. It is their family business and only source of income. Their bakery is famous for its delicious lepyoshki and you can always buy hot, fresh lepyoshki from their store. This is why they always have a lot of customers. Mukaram wants to expand her business. She wants to buy equipment for making dough and with its help, make a lot of dough for baking lepyoshki. In order to accomplish this goal, Mukaram requested a loan which she plans to use to buy this equipment, as well as flour and coal. She relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy equipment to make dough, as well as to buy flour and coal.

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en: Sat is a farmer who plants rice as her main source of income in the area of Battambang province. She is a widowed mother, 61 years old, and blessed with four kids who are dependent on her. She has been involved in rice farming for 12 years. She has borrowed from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for her six past loans, which she has fully repaid. With these loans, she improved her living conditions. Now, she has formed a group of two and is requesting loan of 1,000,000 KHR for each member. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer and to pay the reaping fee. She hopes she can earn a good income to support her business as well as her family.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and fertilizer and pay reaping fees

loans.name: Eko

texts.en:
Eko lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit. Eko is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Eko joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credit. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Eko sees improvements in his shop. For the last month, he has earned an average of $17 - $18 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Oswaldo Antonio

texts.es: Oswaldo tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 6 años quien ya se encuentra edad escolar. Para Oswaldo lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que dedica su tiempo al comercio de pescado. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por lo que vio la oportunidad de la pesca y es así como desde hace 15 años se dedica a la pesca y luego a la comercialización del mismo. Con el sueño de mejorar su situación económica y dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida a tomado la decisión de invertir en artículos de pesca dado que es necesario renovar sus artículos para que el proceso de pesca sea más fácil y así pueda tener más mercadería para la venta. Con el monto solicitado comprará: anzuelos, redes, plomo, trasmallos, etc.
texts.en: Oswaldo is 29 years old and lives in his own house with his partner and their 6 year old daughter who is now of school age. The most important thing to Oswaldo is his family and it is for her that he dedicates his time to commercial fishing. He didn't have the opportunity to study and so he saw the opportunity to fish and so it was that he began fishing 15 years ago and later marketing his fish. With the dream of improving his economic situation and giving his family better living conditions, he took the decision to invest in fishing tackle as it was necessary to update his tackle to make the process of fishing easier and so that he could have more merchandise to sell. With the requested amount, he will buy: hooks, nets, lead, trammel nets, etc.

loans.use: to buy: hooks, nets, weights, and trammel nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish, dry meat, rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia is a married woman, and a mother of three children from Guindulman, Bohol. She has earned a living through her sari-sari or retail store business for several years. As of now, she needs additional capital for the expansion of her business. Emelia is asking for a loan to buy stocks for her store such as rice, canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, coffee, sugar and more. With this, she will be able to add more stocks for her store, thus allowing her to attract more buyers. In the future, Emelia hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her store such as rice, canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, coffee, sugar and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blouses, lappa (fabric), trousers, and shirts for her business.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is a fish vendor from the town of Guindulman, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of three children ages 12, 10 and 6. 

Charito has been in this business for more than nine years. This is the source of her income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell in the market. With this loan, she will be able to increase her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Charito hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Nur

texts.en:
Nur lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Nur is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Nur joined Ruma one month ago because she found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Nur sees improvements in her shop. For the last month, she earns an average of $6 - 7 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Nason

texts.en: Nason’s clients are the tea factories in his area of operation, and the tea traders who buy his tea so that they can later sell it to the factories. Nason also sells bananas as a way of getting additional income, just in case the tea business does not perform well. He earns some money from the sale of bananas to sustain his family. He hopes to use the loan money amounting to two million shillings, to buy fertilizers to boost the fertility of the soils, so that he can harvest much more. His main challenge is the dry season, since it causes his tea to dry. This affects the sales and the incomes negatively, but he believes that if he applies the fertilizers the soil, fertility will be boosted, and he will harvest much more and be in position to build a permanent home, which has always been his dream in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers and used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Agung

texts.en: Agung lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit.  Agung is single. He joined Ruma one month ago because he found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Agung sees improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he earns an average of $54 - 55 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married with children. She describes herself as being visionary and focused. She operates a retail business where she sells assorted soap, including liquid soaps. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are individuals living in Teshie. She will use her GHS 1,000 loan to buy more assorted soaps to sell to customers. Her business goal is to be a successful businesswoman within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy more assorted soap to sell to customers.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married with children. She describes herself as being a visionary and focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and cooking oil. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are individuals living in Teshie. 

Joyce will use her 2,000 GHS loan to buy more tomatoes, onions, garden eggs, kernel oil, and palm oil to sell to customers. Her business goal is to be a successful businesswoman within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, onions, garden eggs, kernel oil, and palm oil to sell to customers.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a fish vendor from the town of Guindulman, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of three young children. 

She has been selling fish in her neighborhood for more than five years. This is the source of her income. 

Corazon is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and a new weighing scale. With this, she will be able to improve her sales as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more fish and a new weighing scale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a married woman, and a mother of four children from Guindulman, Bohol. She operates a motor repair shop with her husband. This is the source of their income. Evelyn is asking for a loan to buy materials such as chains and bolts, bearings, screwdrivers and others. With this, they will be able to service more repair requests from their customers. In the future, Evelyn hopes of making their business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials such as chains and bolts, bearings, screw drivers and others.

loans.name: Jurse

texts.en:
Jurse is determined to carry on with his business. This is the reason why he has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX which he hopes to use to buy fertilizers to apply on the tea garden. He wants to boost the fertility of the soils to give him enough harvests so that he can earn a higher income. 

Tea growing is his sole source of income. The reason why he gives it so much of his time is so that he can get enough income to cater to the needs of the family. The money he has so far earned in profits is not enough to buy fertilizers. This is why he has applied for a loan. He would like to harvest a lot more in the future and be able to change the living standards of his family. 

His main challenge is the dry season which reduces the harvests and thus reducing the incomes from his business. Despite all the odds, Jurse is willing to work harder and to give the children a bright future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Aripin

texts.en:
Aripin lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit. Aripin is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Aripin joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credit. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Aripin sees improvements in his shop. For the last month, he has earned an average of $13 - $14 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Jeneroza

texts.en: Jeneroza is a married woman with four children who are all in school. Jeneroza deals in cassava trade where she has been able to earn a living to take care of her family. She operates her business with capital of 300,000 UGX. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 UGX to help her buy more cassavas for trade and to use to pay school fees for her children. Jeneroza is working very hard to make sure she raises enough money to pay tuition for one of her daughters who is currently studying at university. She hopes to increase her sales to 100 bags of cassava every season. Her major challenge is thieves who break into her store and steal her cassava after she has invested her loan money. Jeneroza hopes to construct a permanent house for her children.

loans.use: to buy cassavas to sell.

loans.name: Yosam

texts.en:
Yosam is a farmer in Kashozi in Nyabubare Sub County in Bushenyi District. He grows tea. He started farming in 2008 with the objective of getting a clear source of income. Since tea growing was the most paying activity in the area, he took it up. He works eleven hours per day and five days per week. Yosam is married and they have six children with the last three in school. 

Yosam has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX which he hopes to use for buying fertilizers so that the soil fertility can be boosted which will increase the quantity harvested at the end of a given period. His clients are mainly tea traders in the same area and the factories which buy the green tea for processing. In his area of operation, there are many other people growing and selling tea and this increases the competition which is his major challenge. He is hopeful that, if the loan is given and he applies the fertilizers, he will harvest good quality tea and will out compete the competitors. The dry season is the other challenge he faces but he is hopeful that the challenge will also be overcome especially if he keeps being the hardworking person he has always been. 

Yosam's hopes for the future include widening the tea garden, making enough profits and being financially stable which will help him achieve his dream in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is married with three children who are all in school. He works as a bricklayer to earn income to look after his family. He has applied for a loan of UGX 700,000 to buy firewood to burn his bricks. His customers are his neighbors in the village. George hopes to be the best brick maker in the whole village given the necessary support. His major challenges are the rainy season and the poor road networks. Despite these challenges, George is a very hardworking and honest man.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, es una persona de 38 años de edad, vive con sus cuatro hijos en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, el primero de sus hijos tiene 15 años, estudia tercero básico, el segundo tiene 13 años estudia primero básico, el tercero tiene 8 años está en cuarto primaria, y el último tiene 10 meses, obtiene ingresos por la venta de maxán, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 35 años, le gusta cultivar maxán por que no utiliza químicos en la producción y no daña el medio ambiente, también traslada personas de un municipio a otro en su pick-up, Manuel solicita un crédito a ADICLA por un monto de Q. 7,000.00 para compra una cuerda de terreno para cultivar más maxán, en el futuro Manuel quiere comprar otro pick-up para seguir haciendo viajes.
texts.en: Manuel is 38 years old and lives with his four children in the municipality of Nahualá, in the department of Sololá. His oldest child is 15 years old and is in the third level of secondary school, the second child is 13 years old and in the first level of secondary school, the third child is 8 years old and is in the 4th grade of primary school, and the youngest is 10 months old. He makes a living selling maxán, a type of leaf that is used for wrapping tamales. He has been doing this for 35 years. He likes to grow maxán because chemicals aren't used in its production and it doesn't damage the environment. He also transports people from town to town in his pick-up. Manuel is requesting a loan from ADICLA for the amount of $925 to buy an acre of land to grow more maxán. In the future Manuel wants to buy another pick-up so that he can keep making journeys.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal, rice, palm oil, onions, fish, meat, peppers, and more for her business.

loans.name: Marlyn Yaneth

texts.es:
Marlyn  tiene 29 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado,  está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene tres hijos que están estudiando,  y nadie más vive con ellos. 

Marlyn  trabaja con su compañero de vida en la agricultura, su papá le enseñó a trabajar y hoy para ahorrarse el  pago de mozos le ayuda a su compañero de vida, ella se levanta temprano a preparar el desayuno que llevará al trabajo y para dejarles la comida a sus hijos, para llegar al lugar de trabajo camina aproximadamente 30 minutos, trabaja 5 horas  ya que tiene que regresar para tener listo el almuerzo y en la tarde dedica el tiempo a sus hijos, ella lo hace con todo gusto ya que quiere sacar delante a su familia.

El préstamo será utilizado en la siembra de una hectárea maíz, comprará abono, semilla, veneno y preparará la  tierra. 

Ella sueña con que sus hijos se preparen con una carrera universitaria ya que ella no lo pudo lograr, construir su casa de ladrillo porque la que tiene es de adobe.
texts.en:
Marlyn is 29 years old, and she has studied up to the fifth grade.  She is in a relationship, and her partner works in agriculture. She has three children who are studying, and no one else lives with them.

Marlyn works, along with her life partner, in agriculture. Her father taught her how to work, and now, in order to save labor costs she helps her life partner.  She rises early in order to prepare the lunch that she will bring to work, and to feed her children.  In order to get to the work site she walks approximately 30 minutes. She works for 5 hours, as she has to return home in order to have lunch ready, and she dedicates the time in the afternoon to her children. She takes great pleasure in doing this, as she wants to raise her family.

The loan will be used for planting a hectare [2.47 acres] of corn, for buying fertilizer, seed, and poison, and for preparing the soil.

She dreams of her children being prepared to go to college, as she was not able to do so, and she dreams of building her house out of brick because the one that she has is made of adobe.

loans.use: to plant a hectare [2.47 acres] of corn, to purchase fertilizer, seed and poison, and to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Donozio

texts.en:
Donozio is a farmer who grows tea in Kyenkaka cell in Rushsyo in Bushenyi-Ishaka. He is 56 years old and started farming in 1974 with a hope of getting a clear source of income to use to provide for basic needs of his family members. Farming is his major source of income. He also sells milk which gives him additional income. 

He has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to be able to buy fertilizers which he hopes will boost the fertility of the soils where his tea garden is located. Donozio hopes to get enough income from the increased yields. His clients are mainly the tea traders in the same area where he operates and the factories which buy tea for processing. 

Donozio is a hardworking man who works five days on the tea garden every week and uses the other two days of the week to look for a market for his tea. He is mainly challenged by the weather, especially the dry season since it does not favour the tea and instead dries up the plants. 

He is hopeful that if he gets the loan and applies the fertilizers, the yields will be higher and he will get relatively big profits from the business. He will then be in a position to provide for his family members.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys earns a living through her hog raising business. She has been in the business for more than two years now. Gladys is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business, as well as her income. Moreover, she can continue to send her children to school with her earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Lealtad Y Disciplina Group

texts.es:
VICENTA, tiene 39 años de edad, ella forma parte del grupo "Lealtad y Disciplina" formado por siete socios, unidos con el mismo fin de hacer crecer sus negocios mediante el trabajo conjunto y la responsabilidad.
Desde hace cinco años, Vicenta se dedica a la administración de su pequeña bodega, la cual la ha implementado en un espacio libre en su domicilio. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, recibe el apoyo de su familia quienes le ayudan en las ventas y atención de sus clientes. 
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos de abarrotes y bebidas para surtir su bodega.
texts.en: Vicenta is 39, she is part of the group “Loyalty and Discipline” formed by seven members, united by the same goal of growing their business through work and responsibility.  Five years ago, Vicenta started working in her small convenience store, which she set up in an area of her residence.  She works every day starting early, he is supported by her family who help with sales and customer service.  The loan will be invested in buying groceries and drinks to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries and drinks for her convenience store.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: María, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ha cultivado granos básicos como maíz, frijoles y café en el terreno de su casa. Lleva varios años dedicándose a esta actividad. La producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos la cual cubre sus gastos. Ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo por 6,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes e insumos para la siembra de otra parcela de maíz y frijol para aumentar la producción e ingresos. Su objetivo es comprar un terreno para tener más tierra donde cultivar.
texts.en: 34 year old María is a single mother. She has 2 children who she lives with in a village in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. She has always worked as a farmer, growing staple grains such as corn, beans, and coffee on the land by her house. She has been doing this for some years. She sells her produce in the local market. This activity is the source of income that she uses to cover her expenses. She has decided to request another loan of $325 to buy fertilizers and supplies to sow another parcel of corn and beans to increase her production and income. Her goal is to buy more land so she can have more to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies to sow another parcel of corn and beans.

loans.name: Will Alfredo

texts.es:
Don Will de 29 años de edad, padre de dos hijos junto con su compañera de vida tratan la manera que nada les falte a sus dos pequeños hijos, la esposa de don Will tiene una venta de frutas ambulante, ella sale camina por la comunidad ofreciendola al publico.

Don Will al formar su hogar aprendio junto a su cuñado a elaborar teja y formar su propio negocio de la misma, es de la cual recibe ingresos para suplir algunas nesecidades de su familia siempre acompañado de la ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos que apesar de ser tan solo unos niños les gusta ayudarle a su padre en las actividades para sacar la teja a la venta. 

Don Will ademas de estos trabajos tambien se dedica a la venta de pasteo y venta de ganado el cual genera un ingreso mas para mejorar su economia, él aprendio a cultivar la tierra oficio que aprendio de su padre, junto con su esposa y acompañado de sus niños caminan una hora de su casa hasta el lugar donde realiza la siembra de maíz, su esposa colabora con la preparacion de la tierra hasta le ayuda a cultivar el fruto.

Con el credito se le estara ayudando para que compre materiales con los cuales fabricara la teja como: barro, sacate, tierra blanca y tierra negra y leña para hacer y quemar la teja y sacarla a la venta.
el sueño de Don Will es que su familia vivan bien economicamente sin que nada les falte y que sus hijos puedan estudiar hasta poder graduarse de la universidad.
texts.en:
Don Will is 29 years old and the father of two children. Together with his life partner, they are trying to to find a way to give their two small children everything they need. Will's wife has a mobile fruit stand, and she goes out into the community selling to the public.

When he built his home, Will, along with his brother-in-law, learned to make roof tiles, and he started his own roof tile business. It's from that business that he earns income to meet some of his family's needs. He always has the help of his wife and their children; despite being just kids, they enjoy helping their father with the work of getting the tiles ready to sell.

In addition to that work, Will also earns money selling fodder and cattle, which generates additional income to improve his finances. He learned to farm the land from his father. Accompanied by his wife and their children, he walks an hour from their house to the place where he plants corn. His wife contributes, from preparing the soil to helping him to cultivate the fruit.  

The loan will help him to buy materials to make roof tiles, including clay, thatch, white soil, black soil, and firewood to fabricate and bake the tiles and offer them for sale.

Will's dream is for his family to live well financially without lacking anything, and for his children to be able to stay in school until they can graduate from a university.

loans.use: to buy clay, thatch, white soil, black soil, and firewood to fabricate and bake roof tiles and offer them for sale.

loans.name: Erkamo

texts.ru: Еркамо 43-летняя замужняя женщина и мать одного ребенка. Уже год как ее муж уехал на заработки в Россию, он живет и работает там вдали от семьи. Еркамо в данный момент живет в городе Куляб одна вместе с 20-летним сыном. Ее сын студент. Сама Еркамо зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги портнихи. Он начала эту деятельность год назад и по сей день продвигает ее. Еркамо нуждается в кредите для расширения деятельности. Она хочет купить модернизированную компьютерную швейную машинку, с помощью которой будет делать на платьях вышивки. Таким образом она планирует увеличить количество своих заказов и расширить деятельность.
texts.en: Erkamo is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother to one child. It's already been a year since her husband left to work abroad in Russia. He lives and works there away from his family. Currently, Erkamo lives alone in the city of Kulob with her 20-year-old son. Her son is a student. Erkamo makes a living offering her seamstress services. She started this business a year ago and progresses with it to this day. Erkamo needs a loan to expand her business. She wants to buy a modernized, computerized sewing machine with whose help she will be able to do embroidery on dresses. As a result, she plans to increase her number of orders and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine to develop her sewing business.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en: Ines is a married woman, and a mother of three children from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a food vending business. Her husband is a fisherman.  Ines is asking for a loan to buy more stocks for her food vending business like meat, cooking oil, and materials for fishing like nets, lead weights and others. In the future, Ines hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for her food vending business like meat, and cooking oil, and materials for fishing like nets, lead weights and others.

loans.name: Nur

texts.en:
Nur lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit. Nur is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Nur joined Ruma one year ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credit. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Nur sees improvements in her shop. For the last three months, she has earned an average of $4 - $5 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, toothpaste, rice, sardines, and more, to increase the her business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is a fish vendor from Guindulman, Bohol. A married mother of three children who are still attending school, she is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell. Josefina dreams of improving her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lani

texts.en: Lani is a fish vendor from Bohol, Philippines. In business for more than 30 years, she is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell in order to increase her sales and income. Lani hopes to expand her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Bibimayram

texts.ru: Бибимайрам живет в южной части страны, в районе Шахритус. Она занимается там шитьем. Бибимайрам разведена и воспитывает двоих сыновей одна. Ее сыновьям 5 и 8 лет. Бибимайрам старается работать усердно, чтобы обеспечивать свою маленькую семью. Она единственный добытчик в этой семье. Сейчас она хочет принимать больше заказов, но с ее старой машинкой это невозможно. По этой причине Бибимайрам обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку. Она полагается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Bibimayram lives in the southern part of the country, in the Shahrituz District. She works as a seamstress there. Bibimayram is divorced and raising two sons alone. Her sons are 5 and 8 years old. Bibimayram strives to work hard so that she can provide for her small family. She is the only breadwinner in her family. Now she wants to take more orders, but she is unable to with her old sewing machine. This is why Bibimayram requested a loan to buy a new, modernized sewing machine. She relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to develop her sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients such as peppers, fish, onions, dry meats, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Sadorat

texts.ru: Садорат умелая мастерица в области шитья. Она занимается этим делом у себя дома в течение 3 лет. Трудная жизнь заставила ее изучить эту профессию, так как у нее нет высшего образования. Садорат замужем, ей 25 лет. У нее один маленький ребенок. Ее муж дехканин и он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Садорат помогает мужу в обеспечении семьи. Сейчас она просит кредит для купли тканей и ниток для пошива платьев. Благодаря кредиту она сможет и дальше продолжить деятельность. Этот кредит ей важен, поддержите ее.
texts.en: Sadorat is a skilled artisan in the field of sewing. She has been running this business from her home for the last three years. Her difficult life forced her to learn this profession, as she does not have a higher education. Sadorat is 25 years old and married. She has one young child. Her husband is a communal farmer who grows crops. Sadorat helps her husband provide for their family. Now she is requesting a loan to buy fabric and thread for making dresses. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to continue her business further. This loan is important to her. Please support her.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for making dresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper and salt for her business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su familia en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, tiene dos hijos: de 15 años estudia primero básico y el otro tiene 11 años y está en sexto primaria,  vende pan que ella misma  elabora de manera artesanal, él hermano de su esposo le enseñó esta ocupación desde hace 20 años, Julia necesita un préstamo por un monto de Q. 5,000.00 para comprar una cuerda de terreno, el deseo de Julia es instalar una tienda de consumo diario en su casa  y con ello tener más ingresos para seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en: Julia is 37, lives with her family in the municipality of Nahuala, department of Solola, she has two children, one of them is 15 years old and is in 7th grade, the other one is 11 years old and studies 6th grade.  She sells artisan bread that she makes, her husband's brother taught her this trade 20 years ago.  Julia needs a loan for 5,000 GTQ to buy a piece of land, Julia's wish is to start a convenience store from her house and with this have more income to support her children so that they can continue to study.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia; es una señorita  de 26 años de edad, soltera, vive junto a sus padres  en Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica desde hace 7 años; cuenta que desde pequeña le han gustado los negocios y por ello se dedica a esta labor porque ha adquirido habilidad para llevarlo a cabo. La venta de su producto la realiza en su comunidad. Ella realiza esto porque es la principal fuente de los ingresos que utiliza para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Antonia es visionaria y por ello solicita un préstamo de 10,000 quetzales para la compra de más cortes y blusas para vender más e incrementar sus ingresos.
Sueña con tener una casa que le pueda servir para tener un lugar fijo y amplio para su negocio
texts.en:
Antonia is a 26 year old lady, single, lives with her parents in Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Solala. She buys and sells artisan clothing, has done this for seven years; she has liked the business world since she was little and that's why she works in this business and has acquired the skill to do it.  She sells her product in the community, this is her main source of income, which she uses for the support of her family.
Antonia is a visionary and that's why she is requesting a loan of 10,000 GTQ to buy more styles and blouses to sell and increase her income.
She dreams to have a house where she can have a stable and large location for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and blouses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, dried meat, pepper, cassava and salt for her business.

loans.name: Clelia Alba Luz

texts.es:
La Señora Clelia tiene 36 años de edad,  es casada, tiene 2 hijos, reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad del municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Departamento de Cortés.
Clelia se dedica a la venta de alimentos de la canasta básica desde hace 5 años a través de una pulpería.
Su esposo se dedica a la producción agrícola y ella atiende a sus clientes en el negocio.
Con el propósito de surtir su  pulpería ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 25,000 Lempiras los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de granos básicos, productos de limpieza, cereales, medicamentos de uso común, golosinas, refrescos, harina, manteca, azúcar, huevos, carnes, condimentos y pan.
Ella espera aumentar su clientela al ofrecer variedad de productos, así como sus utilidades que le servirán para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Clelia is 36, she is married, has two children, lives with her family in a community of the Santa Cruz de Yojoa municipality, department of Cortes.  Clelia sells basic need products through a convenience store she's had for 5 years.  Her husband works in agriculture and she tends to the customers at her business.  With the goal to stock her store she has requested a loan for 25,000 HNL that will be invested in buying basic grains, cleaning products, cereals, common use medication, snacks, soda, flour, oil, sugar, eggs, meat, condiments and bread.
She hopes to increase her clientele by offering a variety of products, in addition the income will allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cleaning products, cereals, common use medication, snacks, soda, flour, oil, sugar, eggs, meat, condiments and bread.

loans.name: Unidos Por La Polvora Group

texts.es:
ELVIS YEISON, tiene 30 años de edad, él es socio del grupo "Unidos por la Pólvora". El grupo está formado por siete socios y eligieron el nombre por el lugar donde viven.
Elvis Yeison, se dedica desde hace tres años aproximadamente a dictar clases particulares de matemáticas, ha implementado un espacio en su domicilio donde dicta sus clases a niños de primaria, secundaria y algunos jóvenes para apoyarlos en su preparación pre universitaria.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como plumones de pizarra, libros, hojas para elaborar las prácticas de sus alumnos.
texts.en:
Elvis Yeison is 30 years old. He is a member of the group "Unidos por la Pólvora." This group is formed by seven members, and they chose the name because of the place where they live.

Elvis Yeison has been working for about three years giving private classes in mathematics. He has set up a space in his home where he gives classes to children in primary and secondary school and to some youths to help them in their pre-university preparation.

The loan that he receives will be invested in the purchase of materials such as marker pens for the board, books, and paper to develop exercises for his students.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of educational materials to set up his classes and consultancies

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is a married woman and a mother of two children. Leonida earns an income through her sari-sari or variety store business. She sells various goods and items to the people in her community. Leonida is asking for a loan to buy more inventory to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, biscuits, and snack foods. With this, she will be able to improve her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, biscuits, and snack foods to sell in her store

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.es: Carmelina de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia.
