The main hardship that Thuận faces in her life is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thuận hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Oerm

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Choeng Prey District of Kampong Cham province, Oerm is 55 years old and married with five children. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee for 30 years. She is able to earn about US$10 per day to cover the family’s needs. 

Oerm is the first cycled client with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will use a portion of the loan to spend on renovating her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Carlos tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él se dedica a la venta de miel por botellas. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 10 años. Carlos es un  hombre emprendedor quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Él solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada para reparar las paredes de la vivienda ya que con el tiempo se han deteriorado. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento dado que no puede hacerlo por su propia cuenta.
texts.en:
Carlos is 42 years old and lives in a home of his own with his family. For the past ten years he has been in the business of traveling by foot and selling bottled honey.

Carlos is an entrepreneurial man who does everything in his power to give his family the best living conditions. He requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized aluminum to repair the walls of his house, which have deteriorated over time. He hopes to be able to count on this financing, since he cannot afford it on his own.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized aluminum to repair the walls of his home.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Prey Chhor district, Kunthea is 47 years old and married. She has two children. To make a living, she has been growing cassava and also sells grocery items. The current business earns her about 44,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

This is the first microloan for Kunthea with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Kunthea will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es:
El señor Eustaquio tiene 45 años, es casado,  tiene dos  hijos, por quienes esta pareja está luchando para sacarlos adelante.
El señor Eustaquio tiene un copetín, donde también hace ventas de comestibles,  tiene  buena ubicación, y comenta que tiene su local propio.
Comenta que se inició como vendedor ambulante luego puso su local propio, que hasta hoy le va muy bien. El pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de golosinas, bebidas, e insumos para hacer comestibles para la venta. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Eustaquio is 45 years old, married, and has two children. He and his partner are striving to move forward.

Sr. Eustaquio has a snack bar where he sells food. It is in a good location and he says that he owns the shop where his business is established. Eustaquio recounts that he started out as a street vendor before setting up his own shop, which is doing very well today. He is requesting a loan in order to buy snack foods, beverages, and supplies for preparing dishes that he can sell.

Eustaquio is grateful for the opportunity he has received so that he can keep growing in the same manner as he is doing now.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, beverages, and supplies for preparing dishes that he can sell.

loans.name: Marlon Miguel

texts.es:
El día 17 de agosto nació un niño llamado Marlon Miguel que desde el primer momento, desde el primer llanto, desde el primer respiro sabía que el destino eran los autos, el sueño más grande. 
A los días, el padre ya jugaba con el con los carros que el le compraba al niño, cuando el pequeño jugaba con los autos pensaba que así iba hacer cuando grande, que cuando fuera mayor no iba a jugar con los autos si no que los iba a reparar, iba a interactuar con ellos a la medida que fuera uno de los mas grandes famosos mecánicos del país y del mundo, que todas esas veces que veía televisión con los padres y ver a los mecánicos reparar esos autos el iba a hacer el próximo,  el iba a cumplir los sueños con los esfuerzos que iban hacer los padres para que lograra las metas que el tenia,  las cuales el iba a cumplir con ayuda de los padres y con la ayuda de dios. 
Al tiempo el joven término el bachillerato, anhelaba  salir para poder entrar a una institución la cual lo pudieran ayudar a lograr  los sueños, los cuales solo lo podía lograr si lo ayudaban, por que el  tiene muchas ansias de estudiar, de colaborar con todo lo que le digieran, el joven quería estudiar mucho en un instituto que había mirado, a el le gusto mucho si no que había un pequeño problema  y el presupuesto  no era suficiente, a el le dieron unas formas de ayuda la cual fue kiva, el estaba muy interesado, el al instante se puso hacer lo que le habían dicho. 
El desea ser el mejor en el  instituto y no defraudar  por la ayuda que le van a prestar, el muchacho ya con ganas de estudiar mucho, de estar en el instituto explotando todas las ganas de arreglar los autos de ayudarle a todas las personas que necesiten de los conocimientos y aprendizajes que le van a dar en el instituto campo alto.
texts.en:
On the 17th of August, a boy named Marlon Miguel was born. From his first moment, his first breath, his first cry, it was clear that his destiny and greatest dream would be: cars. 

As the days passed, his father bought him toy cars and played with him, and when the boy played with the cars he thought it was going to be this way when he was grown. Except, instead of playing with cars, he would repair them. He would interact with them as if he were one of the greatest of the famous mechanics of the country and the world. Each time he watched television with his parents, and would see the mechanics repairing cars, he knew was going to be the next. He would fulfill his dreams thanks to the great efforts of his parents to help him fulfill his goals. 

He would fulfill his goals with the help of his parents and with the help of God. In time, the young man finished high school, and yearned to go out and enter into an institution which would help him achieve his dreams. He wants to study in the institution he has seen.  

He could only fulfill these dreams if he were able to get help. He would be very pleased if there wasn't the small problem of his budget, which wasn't enough. He was offered a few forms of aid, one of which was a Kiva loan. He was very interested in the loan and immediately began following instructions. Because of his great aspirations to study, he would comply with all the instructions he is given.

He hopes to be the best in the school and to stay current with the payment of the money which will be lent to him. He has great motivation to study, to be in the institute taking advantage of his eagerness to fix cars and to help all the people who need the knowledge and training he will gain through CampoAlto.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Vanthorn

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Vanthorn is aged 27 years and married with one kid. For more than nine years, she and her husband have been farming rice as the primary source of the family’s income to make a living. To supplement the income, Vanthorn also works as a garment worker.  Together, they can earn about KHR 50,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 30,000 each day for their future needs. 
Vanthorn has just joined VisionFund for this cycle and now she is requesting a loan to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes to grow more crops so as to fulfill her dream of raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is 35 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district. Rice farming and cassava crops are the main sources of her family’s income. The current business earns her family daily income of about 30,000 KHR and she is able to save 13,000 KHR each day. 
This is the first loan for Mom with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Mom is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to make a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es estudiante de la Carrera de Ingeniería Agroindustrial, es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder cumplir sus metas de ser un profesional exitoso que pueda ayudar a las demás personas. Cuenta que su prestamo anterior lo uso para poder cubrir sus gastos de manutención.
Hoy Jose pide de un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de útiles, lo que le permitirá seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo y también estar cada vez mas cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Jose is studying for a degree in Agroindustrial Engineering. He is striving to accomplish his goals so that he can become a successful professional and help other people. Jose says that his previous loan was used to cover his living expenses.

Today he is requesting a new loan so that he can invest in the cost of supplies, which will enable him to continue his studies. As he progresses, Jose is getting closer to his goal each time.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for his coursework.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en: Kristine is a married woman and a mother of three young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is operates a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods to the people in her local area. Kristine is asking for a loan to buy more stock such as biscuits, snack foods, candies, soda and toiletries,. With this, she will be able to improve her stocks thus attracting more buyers. In the future, Kristine hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as biscuits, snack foods, candies, soda and toiletries,

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith has a bar in Hoima Uganda.She is widowed with five children and all attend school.She works seven days a week.Judith started business so as to educate her orphans. She intends to expand her business into new market areas but is challenged  by high transportation costs and limited capital. A determined parent to raise income to educate her children to university, Judith is asking for a loan to buy more beers and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: buy more beers and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en:
Sochea, 25, lives in a rural village of the Kampong Thom province’s Stoeng Sen district. He is single and makes a living through working as a salesman at a private company in the village. His current job earns him about US$13 per day to support his daily expenses.  
Sochea has just joined VisionFund for this cycle. Now he is asking for an education loan to pay for his university fees to study Economics. He hopes this loan will enable him to stay in university until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees to study Economics

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Saem's Group

texts.en:
Saem, 33, is from a rural village located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with three children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and also buying and selling cashew nuts in her village. Having been in this business for 13 years, she is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Saem has been with VisionFund for five cycles and successfully repaid her past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is 57, married and blessed with six children. They are currently residing in a rural community and she makes a living through farming. She also runs a small retail store to make additional income. Due to financial hardship, she aims to improve her retail store to generate sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, she wants to take a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy more grocery items such as rice, fish, dressed chicken and soft drinks to sell. Being a kind and diligent mother, she is hoping that she will make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items such as rice, fish, dressed chicken and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu is 43 years old with 4 children. she is dealing in cocoa farming as the primary business with the aim of increasing on her capital. since she is dealing in agriculture products, seasonal changes normally affect her income by reducing on the product prices. Her market segment is composed of both men and women and she hopes to expand on the size of her business. Zainabu is requesting for a loan to buy cocoa and food stuffs for selling.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and food stuffs for selling,

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a hardworking woman aged 34 years having 4 children. She grows cocoa, dries it and sell to both men and women in Bundibugyo-Uganda. Juliet works so hard even if seasonality changes affect her yields negatively thus reducing on her output and profit margin. she dreams of buying a permanent land of her own where she can do extensive farming without paying any cost. Juliet needs the loan to buy more cocoa for selling this peak season.

loans.use: To buy more cocoa for selling this peak season.

loans.name: La Dolorosa Del Pueblito  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Credito La Dolorosa del Pueblito se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
Este es un grupo de  11 mujeres y 2 hombres que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Banco Comunal que les ayudado de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios y su calidad de vida. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señorita Sonia, tiene 26 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de los padres, ella estudia licenciatura en Ciencias De La Educación. 
Doña Sonia es una joven muy trabajadora que a base de esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante sus estudios `para tener un mejor porvenir y así poder formar una familia, ella tiene una tienda de víveres y bazar en su casa,  este negocio lo empezó hace 8 años, primero fue la tienda y con el paso de los  años surtió su pequeño bazar, así ella se financia sus estudios y también ayuda a sus padres que son de escasos recursos, su mamá le ayuda en su negocio cuando ella tiene que salir a la universidad en la cual estudia. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres para surtir la tienda y artículos de bazar. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella mejora siempre su negocio y su vida. Sus sueños es terminar sus estudios y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The Credit Group La Dolorosa del Pueblito meets every 15 days in the Canton Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are recognized nationally and internationally. It is the place of the famous straw hats.  
This group is composed of 11 women and 2 men who decided to get together and form a Communal Bank which has helped them a lot because through the loans obtained they have improved their small businesses and quality of life.  They carry out various activities including commerce, services, and food sales, among other activities.  
One of the partners in the group is Sonia who is 26 years of age, single, lives with her parents, and is studying for a degree in Education Sciences.  Sonia is a hard working young woman whom due to her efforts has been able to advance in her studies to have a better future and be able to form a family.  She has a shop with foodstuffs and a bazaar in her house.  She started the business 8 years ago, first with the store and then the bazaar as time went by.  This is how she finances her studies and helps her parents who have limited resources.  Her mother helps her at the store when she needs to leave for the university where she studies.  
This loan will help her buy foodstuffs to stock her store and also bazaar articles.  She's been with the Credit Group from the start and she likes it because thanks to the loans she improves her business and her life.  Her dream is to finish her studies and be a great professional.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and bazaar articles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Willian Andres

texts.es: Andres es un joven de 25 años de edad, él es casado y vive con su esposa y su hija de 2 años, Andres se dedica a la agricultura, trabaja en el campo y también trabaja de albañil ya que dice que realiza algunas actividades para solventar los gastos de su familia, su esposa le apoya en todo lo que puede para salir adelante juntos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y fungicidas para cuidar bien los sus cultivos, la aspiración de Andres es que le vaya muy bien en la cosecha para comprar un terreno donde pueda sembrar sus plantas.
texts.en:
Andres is a young man who is 25 years of age. He is married and lives with his wife and his two-year-old daughter. Andres engages in agriculture by working in the fields. He is also a bricklayer and says that he does a few construction jobs to help pay for his family’s expenses. His wife helps in every way she can so that they can move forward together.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of compost and fungicides so that he can take excellent care of his crops. Andres aspires to do very well with his harvest so that he can buy a plot of land where he can plant his crops.

loans.use: to buy compost and fungicides.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en: Rosenda and her husband are both farmers who live in a rural community. They are hoping to improve their standard of living to give their two children a better life. They are engaged in growing various seedlings for sale. They planned to produce more seedlings to sell but they do not have enough capital. For this reason, Rosenda is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and plastics needed to grow the various seedlings. They are hoping that this financial assistance will enable them to produce more seedlings to sell in the local community.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and plastics needed to grow seedlings

loans.name: Gavharkhon

texts.en: Gavharkhon was born in 1968. She is a hardworking and industrious woman. Gavharkhon is married and has 2 children. Her adult children are Maruf and Gulbahor, both students. Gavharkhon works as a sewer. She sews women's national dresses. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Gavharkhon’s son is a student at the Medical University of Tajikistan. Her daughter studies at the Economic faculty of Tajikistan State University. They study hard. Gavharkhon does not have enough money to pay for their tuition and she is asking for a loan of 2000 USD to pay for the tuition fees. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for her children's tuition fees

loans.name: Marìa Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es una señora de 28 años de edad ella vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 5 años, 3 años y un mes de edad, los 2 mayores se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela, ella se dedica a criar chanchos y le ayuda a su esposo en su trabajo ya que él se dedica a la agricultura, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para criarlos y luego venderlos  para obtener ingresos que ayuden a solventar los gastos de su familia, Isabel sueña con comprar una casa y mejorar la  calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 28-year-old woman. She lives with her husband and three children (ages 5, 3, and 1 month). The two older children are in school.

Isabel raises pigs and helps her husband, a farmer, with his work. This loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs that she can raise and eventually sell so that she can help with her family’s expenses.

Isabel dreams of buying a house and improving her children’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is a hardworking married woman with children living in Hoima,Uganda. She owns a restaurant where she works seven days a week and twelve hours a day. She started business so as to improve her welfare. She desires to see her business grow and her children attaining education to a level of self sustainability despite the challenge of high operational costs and competition from people with similar businesses. Scovia is acquiring a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to  pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Domingo Alcides

texts.es:
Domingo de 29 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, es padre de tres hijos y otro bebé que viene en camino.
con su poco estudio que recibio tiene que luchar para llevar el pan de cada dia a su familia, ya que su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa.


Domingo se levanta muy temprano para salir a trabajar desde las 3:00 de la mañana para elaborar el material que utiliza para fabricar la teja, oficio que lo aprendio de su padre desde que era un niño, él les da el sustento diario a su familia y tiene a cargo a su madre y una hermanita; por la razón que trabaja arduamente. En la epoca de invierno se dedica a la siembra de granos basicos, frijoles, maiz y maicillo, ya que estos son el sustento principal para ellos y la otra parte de los granos los comercializa en la plaza del pueblo.

El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en la compra de de materiales para seguir elaborando la teja y asi hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar mayores ganancias que le permitiran tener una mejor economia.

Su sueño,  es que sus hijos tengan un alto nivel de estudio y en un futuro sean profecionales y tengan una mejor economia y mejor calidad de vida que los pueda sacar adelante, ampliando su negocio obtendra buenas ganancias y podra darle a su familia lo que necesite y en el momento oportuno.
texts.en:
Domingo, 29 years old, works in agriculture, father of three children with another baby on the way. With the little education he received, he has to struggle to put food on the table for his family, as his wife takes care of household affairs.

Domingo gets up very early to leave for work at 3:00 in the morning to make the materials used to produce tiles, a trade he learnt from his father as a child, this keeps his family going from day to day, and he also cares for his mother and a younger sister; this is why he works so hard. In winter he works growing staple grains, beans, corn and sorghum [a type of grain], as these are their main food, and he sells the rest of the grains in the town square.

He needs the loan to buy materials to continue making tiles, and to grow his business and make better profits which will enable them to be better off financially.

His dream, is that his children will study to a high level and be professionals in the future and be in a better financial situation and have a better quality of life that can get them ahead, expanding his business will bring good profits and he will be able to give his family all they need and at the right time.

loans.use: to buy materials used for making tiles.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en: Juditha is a married woman and a mother of two children from Bien Unido, Bohol. Judith earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business. Juditha is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her stocks thus attracting more buyers. Juditha wants to expand her business and make it a success . Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 27-year-old farmer in Kigondo B cell, Katunga Sub County in Bushenyi. He has 4 siblings who are dependent upon him. He has so far borrowed once from UGAFODE Microfinance through a loan that was funded by Kiva lenders; he now hopes to borrow 3,000,000 shillings so that he can buy fertilizer to boost the fertility of the soils and buy cows for trade. 

Godfrey's major business is the tea trade, but he also does cattle trade as an additional source of income so that he can make enough profits and be able to look after his siblings without financial constraints. He started doing business with the goal of making money so that he could support his siblings and have a bright future. He is mainly faced with a challenge of stiff competition since most people in the area where he operates grow and sell tea, but he hopes that this will no longer be a challenge since he has decided to diversify and deal in the cattle trade so that he can have different sources of income. 

Godfrey is a very hard-working man who hopes to enlarge his businesses (the cattle trade business and the tea business) and become financially stable in the future. His clients are mostly the tea traders and the cattle traders in the same area he operates in. He is hopeful that if he gets the loan he will serve his clients better and consequently, enjoy the benefits of customer loyalty which will make his life and the lives of his siblings more enjoyable and worth living.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a married man and a father of six children aged between 10 and 27 years old. He is a hardworking man who started farming in 2004 with the hope of getting a clear source of income. He works twelve hours per day, five days each week, which gives him ample time to concentrate on tea farming so that he can earn more from the business. The business is located in a rural area. He is challenged by the constant loss of soil fertility and now wants a loan to buy organic manure in order to restore the soil fertility and productivity in the long run.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Amigos Por siempre Calle Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en Montecristi conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Ruth, tiene 52 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, los dos varones aun viven en su casa.
Doña Ruth es una muy buena madre que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante, ella para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual logra obtener sus recursos y salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Credit Group Amigos Por siempre Calle Chimborazo meets every 15 days in Montecristi know for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts recognized nationally and internationally.  It's the place of the famous straw hats.  
Ruth, who lives here, is 52 years of age, she's separated, and has 4 children from that relationship, all adults now, but her two sons still live at home.  Ruth is a very good mother who has always liked to work to move forward in life.  To obtain her own resources she sells clothes by catalog and Yanbal products, a cosmetics brand, including beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women accessories.  She works three days a week between two and three hours a day.  She sells her products on credit and collects the money every eight days.  She has been doing this for 5 years and is able to obtain enough resources to move forward.  
This loan will help her buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and clothes.  She has been in the Credit group from the beginning and she likes it because of the help she's given by the institution.  Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Djekafo 2 Group

texts.fr:
DJEKAFO 2 est un groupe de l’association BINBAGALAWILI. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans. Mariées avec moyenne deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de fruits à l’image de CHATA qui est la deuxième personne assise de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à  SELINGUE (Région de Sikasso, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de fruits: pomme, orange et banane. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.
CHATA, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de fruit de différente sorte (pomme, orange et banane).  Elle s’approvisionne à SELINGUE et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses fruits à SELINGUE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de fruits.
texts.en:
Djekafo 2 is a group within the Binbagalawili association. It includes women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 27 years old, married with two children.

They conduct various activities such as the buying and selling of fruit, like Chata who is the second person sitting from left to right in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Selingue (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are very sought after in their fruit-trading activities: apples, oranges and bananas.

In order to satisfy the growing needs of their customers, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their first group loan.

Chata plans to use the loan to buy a large amount of different kinds of fruit (apples, oranges and bananas). She gets her supplies in Selingue and from local wholesalers. She retails the fruit in Selingue, for cash and on credit to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to attain monthly profits of 30.000 CFA francs, which will enable her to reimburse the loan and reinvest in her fruit-trading activity.

loans.use: buy fruit

loans.name: Rakib

texts.en: Rakib was born in 1965. He is married and has 3 children. Rakib has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 20 years. Rakib buys cattle, feeds them for three months and sells them in a local market. His wife works in a factory. His son helps him to manage the business. His daughter is a student of the Tajikistan State University of Commerce. She studies at the faculty of Accounting and Finance. He is asking for a loan of 750 USD as he does not have enough money to pay for his daughter's tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's tuition

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married woman and a mother of six children from San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in selling home-cooked foods to the people in her local area. Rosalia also has a rice farm.
Rosalia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and ingredients for food vending such as meat and cooking oil. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm as well as her food vending venture. In the future, Rosalia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and ingredients for food vending such as meat and cooking oil

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en: Salomat is 58 years old. She is married and has 4 adult children. Salomat’s husband is a farmer. She has her own business dealing with animal husbandry. Salomat has been running this business for more than 10 years. She raises milking cows and sells milk, kefir and sour cream to local people. Salomat is going to develop her business as there is a great demand for milk products in her village. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy a milking cow. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a milking cow

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en: Johnbosco is a 32 year old male who lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda. Johnbosco operates a motorcycle transport business that he started so as to increase on his income. In his business he is faced with a difficulty of bad roads where by he is always going for motorcycle repair which is expensive. His dreams is to construct a beautiful residential house hence requesting for a loan to buy building materials like bricks and cement.

loans.use: to buy building materials like bricks and cement.

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
José tiene 64 años, es viudo y padre de 3 hijos dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y ya no viven con él y el  menor tiene 15 años que es el que vive actualmente con él, su hijo menor ya no estudia ya que le ayuda a él  en los trabajos agrícolas.

José tiene ganado y desde muy pequeño aprendió todo lo relacionado a la ganadería y a la agricultura, por medio de su padre ya que desde pequeño le inculco lo del trabajo en el campo. Desde que enviudo ha tenido que salir adelante para lograr darle un futuro a su hijo. 

Con el crédito comprara semilla, abono, fertilizate y todo lo necesario para sembrar la milpa y lograr tener una muy buena cosecha de maíz para luego venderla y poder tener un poco de ingreso en su casa.

José sueña que su hijo pueda salir adelante, ya que por la situación económica de él no puedo darle una educación mejor a su hijo y confiá en Dios que su hijo tendrá un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Jose is 64 years old, a widower and father of three children. Two of them are grown up and no longer live with him. The youngest is 15 years old and currently lives with him, his youngest son doesn't go to school anymore because he helps with the farm work.

Jose tends cattle, and since he was very young learnt everything to do with cattle-raising and farming through his father, as since he was young he taught him all about working on farms. Since he was widowed, he has had to get through in order to give a future to his son.

With the loan he will buy seeds, manure and fertilizer, and all the necessities to sow corn and get a good harvest, to be able sell it and have a bit of income for his family.

Jose dreams that his son can get ahead, as due to his financial situation he cannot give him the best education and he trusts God that his son will have a good future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide.

loans.name: Digma Arely

texts.es:
Digma tiene 22 años, solo logro estudiar hasta séptimo grado, esta acompañada su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 2 hijos, uno de 2 años y otro de 7 años su hijo mayor estudia primer grado. Digma le ayuda a su compañero de vida en los trabajos de la agricultura.
 
 Debido a su situación económica ella se dedica a ayudarle a su pareja en lo de la agricultura, aunque a ella le toca pesado ya que tiene que hacer los oficios del hogar y cuidar a su niño de 2 años, al terminar de hacer los quehaceres del hogar ella le ayuda a su pareja en el trabajo del campo y de igual forma le ayuda a la crianza de ganado.

Con el crédito ella pretende comprar una novilla y posteriormente venderla y con la ganancia que vaya a adquirir pagara su crédito que adquirió con CREDICAMPO y poder mejorar su condición de vida.

El mayor sueño de Digma, es poder darles un buen estudio a sus hijos y tengan las oportunidades que ella no pudo tener y poder ver a sus hijos en un futuro convertidos en unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Digma is 22 years old, she only studied up to 7th grade, she has a life partner and works in farming. She has two children, one is 2 years old and the other is 7 years old. Her oldest son is in school in the first grade. Digma helps her life partner with the farm work. 

Due to her financial situation, she works helping her partner with the farm, even though she feels it's tough as she already has to do the housework and look after her two year old child. After finishing her housework, she helps her partner in the fields and she also helps him raise cattle.

With the loan, she plans to buy a heifer and later sell it. With the profit she will get, she will be able to pay back the loan to CREDICAMPO and will be able to improve her living conditions.

Digma's biggest dream is to be able to give her children a good education, so that they can have opportunities she couldn't have, and in the future to see her children working as professionals.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Kawayida

texts.en: Kawayida is a married man with 12 children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. He sells cocoa only and does not have any additional side income for his family. Seasonality changes leads to low cocoa output thus affecting his income and standard of living but he is a hard working man. He needs a loan facility to buy more cocoa and pay school fees for his children and his dream is to expand his business in future.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and pay school fees.

loans.name: Oyimkiz

texts.en: Oyimkiz was born in 1967. She is a widow and has 5 children. Oyimkiz has been busy for more than 10 years with growing and selling agricultural products. She grows vegetables such as onions, carrots and cabbage. She sells her products in a local market. Oyimkiz has an additional income from sewing. She sews the national dress for women. She has her own regular customers. She is going to develop her business and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 3000 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
SABOUGNOUMA est un groupe de l’association BADENYA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de grain de néré à l’image de AWA qui est la première  personne debout de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles dans la  Sous Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de grain de néré. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
AWA, qui est un membre du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de grain de néré. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 sacs de grains de néré.  Elle  s’approvisionne à  OUELESSEBOUGOU et sur place et vend ses produits à BAMAKO par sac de 100kg, au comptant, à crédit une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité ci-dessous.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma is a group within the Badenya association. It includes women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 37 years old, married with two children.

They conduct various activities such as trading nere seeds like Awa, who is the first person standing from right to left in the photo. They live in large traditional families in the Ouelessebougou sub-district (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are very sought after in their trading of nere seeds.

In order to satisfy the growing needs of their customers, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their first group loan.

AWA, who is a member of the group and very well known in Ouelessebougou, excels in selling nere seeds. She intends to use her loan to buy 10 bags of nere seeds.

She resupplies in Ouelessebougou and locally, and retails her products in Bamako in 100-kilo bags, for cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.

She hopes to attain monthly profits of 25,000 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business activity.

loans.use: buy nere seeds

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.en:
Maftuna is 21 years old. She is young and a smart woman. She is not married and lives with her parents. 

Maftuna is a student of the third course Business and service at the University of Tajikistan. She studies well. Maftuna likes all the subjects that she learns in university. She dreams to be the best specialist in the future. 

Maftuna must pay her tuition but does not have the funds, so she is seeking this loan to help with tuition costs. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Zabibu

texts.en: Zabibu is a married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She trades in both cloth selling as the major business and cocoa selling as a side income with a purpose of increasing her capital. she is a hardworking woman though the prices of her products are affected by seasonality changes. Zabibu's future plan is to buy land for farming but she is intending to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a resident from Bien Unido, Bohol. She earns a living through dried fish vending. This is the source of her income.
Herminia is asking for a loan to buy more fish to dry and sell. With this, she will be able to dry more fish which she can then sell in the market. In the future, Herminia hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman and a mother of 3 children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari, or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her area.

Marissa is asking for a loan to purchase more inventory to sell, such as biscuits and bread, coffee and sugar, soda and beverages, soap, and toiletries. With these items she will be able to attract more customers to her store. Marissa hopes to make her business more successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Super Group

texts.fr:
SUPER est un groupe de l’association SIGUIKAFO de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne un enfant, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’habillements  à l’image de KARIBA  qui est la seule  personne assise de la de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  vente d’habillements : pagne wax et balle de friperie.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt solidaire. 
KARIBA, qui est un membre du groupe et très connue à  TIELE, excelle dans la vente d’habillements. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  1 balle de friperie.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses habits à  TIELE en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femme.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.500FCFA  somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité  d’achat vente d’habillements.
texts.en:
Super is a group within the Siguikafo association of Tiele. It includes women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 27 years old, married with one child.

They conduct various activities such as the trading of apparels like KARIBA which is the only person sitting in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Tiele in the Baguineda sub-district (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are very sought after in their apparel-trading activities: pagne wax (colorful West-African fabric) and bales of second-hand clothing.

In order to satisfy the growing needs of their customers, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their first group loan.

Kariba, who is a member of the group and very well-known in Tiele, excels in selling apparels. She intends to use her loan to buy one bale of second-hand clothing.

She resupplies in Bamako and with local wholesalers and retails her clothes in Tiele, for cash and on credit to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to attain monthly profits of 20,500 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her apparel-trading activity.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine aged thirty three lives in Hoima Uganda. She sells second hand clothes a business she has run since 2013.She hopes to improve her business to a level of a well stocked standard boutique serving mainly corporates in her town. Justine faces a difficulty of seasonal customers whereby her sales increase on public holidays. She needs the loan to stock clothes to sell.

loans.use: to stock clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mier Ahorros (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Dentro de una comunidad muy bonita con gente trabajadora, responsable, amable y muy humilde existe un gran número de habitantes adultos que aún habla su lengua originaria en éste caso es la lengua mazahua. Sin embargo han influido varios factores para que sus pobladores dejen de hablarla poco a poco. En el mismo lugar existe un grupo de personas que conforman el Grupo Mier, cuatro son los integrantes que conforman dicha asociación en VisionFund, ellos se dedican a la cría y engorda de animalitos para su venta.
Juan es el representante del grupo, a él le encanta participar en las actividades de su comunidad y sobre todo ser líder es así como adquirió el puesto de delegado municipal de su comunidad; gracias a ello se enteró de distintos programas que ofrecía el municipio para que sus habitantes se vieran beneficiados con todo lo que en ese momento se proponía y es como obtuvo la oportunidad de iniciar con un negocio de cría y engorda de borreguitos pero sólo lo apoyaron con un porcentaje muy pequeño y tuvo que aportar lo que faltaba. Después de ello buscó a personas que le compraran sus borreguitos ahora él ya tiene a sus clientes a los que solo les hace sus entregas.
Ahora don Juan cuenta con un corral en donde puede atender a sus borregos y muy emocionado cuenta que en unos días llegará a su corral un nuevo borreguito qué cuidar y alimentar como se debe, así su pequeño lugar podrá convertirse en uno más amplio y  sobre todo con más borreguitos que alimentar. Lo más importante es que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa la señora Antonia y sus 2 hijos Jacqueline de 19 años y José Dolores de 18 que en sus ratos libres apoyan a su papá a atender a lso animales.
Juan vive cerca de un campo de fútbol donde cada fin de semana se organizan torneos y se le ha ocurrido que en un futuro le encantaría  colocar una tienda de deportes para que los integrantes de los equipos puedan adquirir sus uniformes y lo que necesiten en su local pero solo lo logrará trabajando como hasta ahora y, pos supuesto, con el apoyo de toda su familia. 
VisionFund  ha cambiado la vida a los integrantes del Grupo Mier ya que gracias a la oportunidad de obtener créditos han logrado que sus negocios vayan creciendo, pero tampoco sería posible sin las ganas y el empeño que ellos tienen para salir adelante. 
Gabriela forma parte del grupo, ella comenta que está iniciando con la cría de borregos gracias al ejemplo que tiene con don Juan, Alicia lleva apenas 4 meses criando a unos cerditos que le podrán generar un ingreso en su hogar cuando logre venderlos y, finalmente, Elvia que también se dedica a la engorda de cerdos. Todos ellos lo hacen con la esperanza de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
Within a very pretty community of hardworking, responsible, kind and humble people, there are a great number of adult residents who still speak their native language, which in this case is the Mazahua language. Nevertheless, the influence of various factors have caused the inhabitants to stop speaking it little by little. In the same region there is a group of people who make up Grupo Mier, four of the members who are part of said organization in VisionFund, work raising and fattening young animals for sale.

Juan is the group representative, and he loves participating in community events and above all being a leader. This is how he got the position of municipal representative of his community; thanks to this he found out about various programs offered in the municipality for the inhabitants to benefit from everything that is currently available. This is how he got the opportunity to start a business raising and fattening lambs, but they only help with with a very small percentage and he had to come up with the remainder. After that, he looked for people who would buy his lambs and now he has customers who only do his deliveries.

Now Juan has a corral where he can look after his lambs and he is very excited, saying that in a few days he will get a new lamb for his corral which he will raise and feed as one should, so his small place can become a bigger one, and above all with more lambs to feed. The most important is the help of his wife Antonia and his two children Jacqueline, 19 years old and José Dolores, 18, who in their free time help their father care for the animals.

Juan lives near a soccer ground and every weekend they organize tournaments and it has occurred to him that in the future, he would love to have a sports store so that the team members can buy their uniforms and everything they need in his store, but he will only achieve this working as he has done up until now, of course, with the support of all his family.

VisionFund has changed the lives of the members of Grupo Mier, as thanks to the opportunity of getting loans, their businesses keep on growing, but this wouldn't have been possible without the will and the determination that they have had to get ahead.

Gabriela is part of the group, she says that she started raising lambs thanks to Juan's example. Alicia has been raising piglets for barely 4 months which will be able to generate income for her household when she is able to sell them and, finally, Elvia who also works fattening pigs. All of them do it in the hope that it will offer a better quality of life for their families.

loans.use: to buy two lambs, food and fodder.

loans.name: Horonya Group

texts.fr:
HORONYA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne six enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de FATOUMATA qui est la deuxième personne assise  de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à SELINGUE Région de Sikasso, République du Mali. 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivres, tomates,  oignons et choux.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
FATOUMATA qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à SELINGUE, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paniers de tomate.  Elle s’approvisionne à SELINGUE et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à SELINGUE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
Horonya is a group in the Benkadi association. It is composed of women who know each other from family and neighborhood ties. They are married and, on average, 34 years old with six children. They live in large traditional families in the Selingue region, Sikasso, Republic of Mali.

The group members, like Fatoumata, who is the second person seated from the left in the photo, engage in different kinds of business, especially the sales of condiments: tomatoes, onions, and cabbage. They have been in this type of small-scale commerce for several years and are highly sought-after, 

In order to meet the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their first group loan.

Fatoumata is the leader of the group and is very known in Selingue, where she excels at selling condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy ten trays of tomatoes. She procures her goods in Selingue from wholesalers, and makes her sales in Selingue at retail for cash and credit to a mixed group of customers. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA which will allow her to pay back the loan and to reinvest in her business of selling condiments.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.en: Arcadia is a married woman and the mother of seven grown up children from Trinidad, Bohol. Arcadia runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Arcadia is asking for a loan to buy more stock of canned goods, candies, bread, biscuits, soap and toiletries to sell. With this, she will be able to attract more buyers thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items like canned goods, candies, bread, biscuits, soap and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy onion seeds for planting.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca de 46 años de edad, solo estudio primer grado y no esta casada y solo depende una hija de ella.

 Tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a la elaboración y comercio de tortillas, esta actividad la ejerce en su casa de habitación es ahí donde los clientes la buscan para comprarle las tortillas como también tiene encargos diarios de diferentes comedores de la ciudad. Esta actividad la aprendió de su mamá que también se dedicaba a dicho oficio. Solo una hija se involucra al negocio con ella.

La señora solicita el financiamiento, para mejorar la vivienda pero también lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tortillas: 4 quintales de maíz, 1 carretada de leña y
20 libras de cal.

Su sueño es que el negocio pueda crecer mas para así generar mas ganancia y vivir en un ambiente mejor.
texts.en:
Blanca is 46 years old, she only studied up to first grade, she is not married and only has one dependent daughter.

She has been working making and selling tortillas for more than 10 years. She runs this business from home and that is where her customers come to buy tortillas. She also has daily orders from various eateries in town. She learned this trade from her mother who was also in this line of work. Only one of her daughters works in the business with her.

She is asking for the loan to do home improvements; and also to buy raw ingredients to make tortillas; 4 quintals of flour, 1 cartload of firewood and 20 pounds of lime.

Her dream is for the business to grow, to generate more income and thus live in a better environment.

loans.use: to do home improvements; and also to buy raw ingredients to make tortillas; 4 quintals of flour, 1 cartload of firewood and 20 pounds of lime.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a farmer growing coffee in Kyanyaruhango in Kyanzaire Kashenshero in Mitooma District. He started farming in 2004 with the hope of getting a clear source of income so that he would able to provide for his family members. He is a married man and the father of ten children who have all finished school except the last three. He also has a bee-keeping project in Kashenshero in Mitooma District and this gives him additional money which he use to cater for the needs of his family. His clients are mainly coffee traders in the same area from which he operates and these have supported him greatly since they assure him of a market for his coffee. He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to be able to buy mulch for the coffee plantation so that the harvests can be better than the usual quantities harvested which would result into higher incomes. He is mainly challenged by the weather which hits his coffee plantation hard but he believes that with the loan, if given, he will have the soil fertility boosted and will be in a position to earn much more and hence be in position to educate all his children (the last three) which has always been his wish, and the reason why he works hard despite the old age bracket he is in now.

loans.use: to buy mulch for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en: Dilafruz is 32 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Dilafruz always tries to maintain the well-being of her children. She has been busy with sewing for more than 6 years. She has her own workshop in the centre of town. Thanks to the good service she provides she attracts regular customers. She is going to buy an embroidery machine but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 1,100 USD to buy an embroidery machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Reginalda

texts.en: Reginalda is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of six children. Reginalda has been in the farming business for more than 20 years now. Reginalda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Farangis

texts.en: Farangis is a young and purposeful woman. She is 20 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Farangis is going to start her own business and in this way to find source of income. She is going to start a sewing business because she cans sew the national dress for women. She will operate the business from her house. She is asking for a loan of 500 TJS to buy a sewing machine so that she can start her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start her new business.

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
SERIEUX est un groupe de l’association BENKADI. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de poissons à l’image de KADIATOU qui est la première personne assise de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à SELINGUE Région de Sikasso, République du Mali. 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de poissons.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
KADIATOU qui est un membre du groupe et très connue à SELINGUE, excelle dans la vente de poissons. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de poissons.  Elle s’approvisionne à SELINGUE et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses poissons à SELINGUE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de poissons.
texts.en:
Serieux is a group in the Benkadi association. It is composed of women who know each other from family and neighborhood ties. They are married and, on average, 41 years old with four children. They live in large traditional families in the Selingue region, Sikasso, Republic of Mali.

The group members, like Kadiatou, who is the first person seated from the right in the photo, engage in different kinds of business, especially the buying and selling of fish. They have been in this type of small-scale commerce for several years and are highly sought-after.

In order to meet the growing need of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their sixth group loan.

Kadiatou is the leader of the group and is very known in Selingue, where she excels at selling fish. She plans to use her loan to buy a large amount of fish. She procures her goods in Selingue from wholesalers, and makes her sales in Selingue at retail for cash and credit to a mixed group of customers. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA which will allow her to pay back the loan and to reinvest in her business of selling fish.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Velina

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is Velina from Chipinge who is 47 years old and is a widow. She has one child who is 25 years old. She has a general dealership shop. Her business is located under Chipinge branch which is located in the south eastern part of Zimbabwe. She has been running this business for over 15 years. She sells her groceries to the local market and has no other source of income. The main challenge she is facing is of inadequate finance to stock up her shop. Velina requested this loan through MicroKing for $600 over 6 months to replenish her grocery shop stock. She says the extra income will help her to adequately stock her shop and this will improve business profitability. In the future she would like to open more outlets.

loans.use: to pay for grocery shop stock.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is Ronnie from Chipinge who is 33 years old. He is married and has 3 children aged 9, 6 and 3 years respectively. Two of them attend school. He operates a flea market under Chipinge branch in the south eastern part of Zimbabwe. He has been running this business for 6 years. His spouse compliments the family income from her sewing business although on a very small scale. His main challenge is that his stock sometimes runs very low when there is high demand - usually during month end. Ronnie has requested this loan through MicroKing for 500 USD over a period of 6 months to increase his stock and widen his product range. He says that the extra income from this loan will improve his stock levels and product range. In the future he would like to own a footwear and clothing shop of his own.

loans.use: to pay for stock for his shop.

loans.name: María Cleofe

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Amigos Por siempre Calle Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 73 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa, con ellos también viven un nieto que tiene 19 años y es como su hijo ya que lo crio desde pequeño,  el estudia en  universidad. Su esposo ya no trabaja por enfermedad.
Doña María es artesana, ella elabora todo tipo de adornos hechos en paja toquilla así como bolsos y carteras, también vende anilina en varios colores (tinta que sirve para pintar  la paja toquilla), esta tinta es muy utilizada por los artesanos de la zona que a diario llegan hasta su casa a comprar este productos con el cual le dan colores a sus obras, ella también utiliza este producto para darles un bello acabado a sus bolsos y carteras, las misma que luego vende a comerciantes que las llevan a  otras ciudades a vender a  muy buen precio.
Este crédito es para comprar paja toquilla y anelina para la venta. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y que su nieto sea un profesional.
texts.en:
The loan group Amigos por Siempre (Friends Forever) Chimborazo Street meets every two weeks in Montecristi, a town known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally renowned crafts.

73-year old Sra. María lives here. She is married and has five adult children, one of whom still lives with her as well as a 19-year old grandson. He is like a son to María as she raised him from a young child. He is now a university student. Her husband no longer works due to illness.

Sra. María is an artisan. She makes all kinds of items woven from straw such as bags and purses. She also sells leather dyes in various colors (used for coloring the straw). The dye is commonly used by local artisans who regularly visit her to buy the product to use on their crafts. María herself uses the dye to give a beautiful finish to the bags and purses which she then sells to merchants who take them to other towns to sell.

The loan Maríia is seeking is to buy straw and dyes to sell. She has been with this loan group since the beginning and is grateful for the help they always provide with loans. Her dream is to maintain her health and for her grandson to get a good job.

loans.use: To buy straw and dyes

loans.name: Benkoro Group

texts.fr:
BENKORO est un groupe de l’association FAIDA de DONGORONA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de céréales à l’image de ROKIA  qui est la première personne debout de la  droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DONGORONA dans la Sous-Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de céréales : riz, maïs et mil. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
ROKIA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à DONGORONA, excelle dans la vente de céréales. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de riz.  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place auprès des grossistes,  et vend ses céréales à DONGORONA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de céréales.
texts.en:
Benkoro is a group in the Faida de Dongorona association. It is composed of women who know each other from family and neighborhood ties. They are married and, on average, 40 years old with four children. They live in large traditional families in the Dongorona region, Ouelessebougou sous-prefecture (Koulikoro, Republic of Mali).

The group members, like Rokia, who is the first person standing from the right in the photo, engage in different kinds of business, especially the buying and selling of cereals like rice, corn, and millet. They have been in this type of small-scale commerce for several years and are highly sought-after.

In order to meet the growing need of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their second group loan.

Rokia is the leader of the group and is very known in Dongorona, where she excels at selling fish. She plans to use her loan to buy two sacs of rice. She procures her goods locally and in Bamako  from wholesalers, and makes her sales in Dongorona at retail for cash and credit to a mixed group of customers. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA which will allow her to pay back the loan and to reinvest in her business of selling cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en: Marhabo is married and has 3 sons who are 9, 11 and 13 years old. She always wanted to provide them with a good education and since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, she decided to start a new business with sewing. She is going to sew the national dress for women and sell it in a local market. She will manage the business alone. She has a big family. Her mother-in-law also lives with her family. Marhabo’s husband is a driver and has a small income. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy a sewing machine to start her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start her new business.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
TIESSIRI est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles la  restauration à l’image de YATA qui est la deuxième personne  debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la Sous-Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali).   
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités, vente de restaurant : viande, poisson, riz et haricot.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième  prêt solidaire. 
YATA, qui  est un membre du groupe et très connue à TIELE, excelle dans la vente de restaurant. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5kg de viandes et poissons et 1 sac de riz.  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité vente de restauration.
texts.en:
Tiessiri is a group in the Benkadi de Tiele association. It is composed of women who know each other from family and neighborhood ties. They are married and, on average, 37 years old with three children. They live in large traditional families in Tiele, Baguineda (Koulikoro region, in the Republic of Mali).

The group members, like Yata, who is standing second from the left in the photo, engage in different kinds of business, especially restaurant food preparation like meat, fish, rice, and beans. They have been in this type of small-scale commerce for several years and are highly sought-after.

In order to meet the growing need of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their sixth group loan.

Yata is the member of the group and is well-known in Tiele, where she excels at selling restaurant food. She plans to use her loan to buy five kilograms of meat and fish and one sac of rice. She procures her goods locally and in Bamako from wholesalers, and sells her food in Tiele at retail for cash and credit to a mixed group of customers. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA which will allow her to pay back the loan and to reinvest in her restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
FOTEMOGOBAN est un groupe de l’association LAYIDOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’habillements  à l’image de FATY  assise au milieu. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou  dans la Préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  vente d’habillements : pagne wax, balle de tissus et prêt à porter.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire. 
FATY, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente d’habillements. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 pièces de pagne wax et  1 balle de tissus.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA  somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité de commerce d’habillements.
texts.en:
Fotemogoban is a group in the Layidou association. It is composed of women who know each other from family and neighborhood ties. They are married and, on average, 42 years old with four children. They live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou, Kati (Koulikoro region, in the Republic of Mali).

The group members, like Faty, who is seated in the middle of the photo, engage in different kinds of business, especially the buying and selling of clothing, like wax pagne [bright colorful fabric], balls of fabric, and ready-to-wear clothes. They have been in this type of small-scale commerce for several years and are highly sought-after.

In order to meet the growing need of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their third group loan.

Faty is the leader of the group and is very known in Ouelessebougou, where she excels at selling clothing. She plans to use her loan to buy ten lengths of wax pagne and one ball of fabric. She procures her goods locally and in Bamako from wholesalers, and makes her sales in Ouelessebougou at retail for cash and credit to a mixed group of customers. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA which will allow her to pay back the loan and to reinvest in her business of selling fish.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Lidiana

texts.es: Es una mujer luchadora, tiene 45 años de edad, está acompañada, tiene 2 niñas de 11 y 8 años respectivamente, que asisten al colegio.  Su esposo no tiene un trabajo formal, se desempeña como albañil. Desde hace 6 años ha vivido de manera inestable con su familia, ya que aún recuerda que cada tres meses tenía que buscar una vivienda con precio accesible a su salario para alquilarla, pagando una mensualidad de C$ 1,500. Sin embargo, con el sueño de tener su propia vivienda y vivir de manera segura, ha luchado por construir su casa de concreto, hace 4 años compró en conjunto con su esposo con sus ahorros y aguinaldo su terreno y con el primero y segundo financiamiento otorgado por PANA PANA, le permitió comprar materiales para su vivienda: bloques, cemento, hierro, arena fina, arena gruesa, madera, zinc, clavos compactar el suelo. Actualmente solicita su tercer financiamiento para iniciar la estructura de su pequeña vivienda de concreto, instaurarle las ventanas y verjas. Su sueño es contar con una vivienda que le brinde las comodidades a su familia, que sus hijas tengan sus propios cuartos, con el propósito de ir reduciendo el hacinamiento, debido a que actualmente en un solo espacio tendrán el dormitorio, sala comedor y cocina. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular condición y comprar un taxi, el cual será utilizado como una herramienta de ingresos para su pareja.
texts.en:
She is a determined woman of 45 years old, married, with two daughters of 11 and 8 years old respectively, who are in school.

Her husband doesn't have a formal job, he pays his debts working as a construction worker. For 6 years they have lived an unstable family life, she recalls that  every three months they have had to look for somewhere affordable to rent, paying C$1,500 monthly.

Nevertheless, with the dream of having their own home and living a secure life, they have struggled to build a concrete home. Four years ago she and her husband together used their savings and bonuses and bought some land with the first and second loan provided by PANA PANA. This enabled them to buy materials for their home: bricks, cement, steel, fine and coarse sand, wood, zinc, nails, and compacted earth.

Now she is asking for her third loan to start building the structure of a small concrete house and fit windows and railings. Her dream is to have a home that offers comfort to her family, that her daughters can have their own rooms, with the aim of reducing overcrowding, as currently they have bedroom, dining room and kitchen all in one space.

She also wants to have a toilet in her home, to build a septic tank, as now they have a regular latrine, and she wants to buy a taxi, which will be used as a way for her partner to earn income.

loans.use: to build the structure of a small concrete house, and fit windows and railings.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
