Lucila tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, costa norte del Perú.

Ella brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, también realiza movilidad escolar trasladando a estudiantes a los colegios de su distrito, su esposo brinda servicio como jornalero agrícola, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales cemento y arena para arreglar su domicilio.
texts.en:
Lucila is 47 years old and lives with her husband and children in Pucará District which enjoys a hot climate and where the local people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising. It is located in Jaén Province in the region of Cajamarca in the north of Peru.

Lucila earns her living in transportation. She has her own motorcycle taxi. She also takes students to their schools in the district. Her husband is a farm laborer.

She is seeking a loan of 1,000 soles to buy cement and sand to renovate her house.

loans.use: Buy cement and sand to renovate her house

loans.name: Genny María

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Amigos Por siempre Calle Chimborazo  se reúne cada quince días en Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Genny, tiene 47 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 29, 22 y 12 años, la menor es la que aun vive con ella y estudia en colegio. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Genny junto a su marido se dedican a la venta de carne de res, de chancho y pollo, esto lo realizan 4 días por semana en un local que tienen en el mercado de la ciudad, pero  en su casa también tienen una tienda de víveres en el cual además de estos productos  venden todo tipo de víveres y artículos de bazar donde trabajan todos los días, mientras su marido vende en el mercado ella se hace cargo de la tienda pero cuando su marido no trabaja en el mercado trabajan juntos en la tienda la cual ya la tienen por más de 15 años y es la que les ha servido para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar carne de res y víveres para surtir su tienda. Este es su segundo ciclo  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Crédito Amigos Por siempre Calle Chimborazo" meets fortnightly in Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, renowned both nationally and internally. It is also the origin of the famous Panama hat.

Genny, who is 47 years old, lives here. She and her common-law husband have three children aged 29, 22 and 12. The youngest still lives with her and attends school. Genny's husband is a trader. She and her husband sell beef, pork and chicken. They do this 4 days a week in premises they have at the town market. However, they also run a grocery store at home where, in addition to this produce, they sell all sorts of provisions and bazaar products, and where they work every day. When her husband is selling at the market she runs the shop, but when her husband isn't selling there, they work together in the shop. They have had this shop for 15 years and it is this that has helped them give their children a good education.

This loan will be used to buy beef and supplies for stocking their shop. It is their second loan with the credit group, and they like it because the repayments are manageable. Their dream is to continue to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy beef and provisions.

loans.name: Mercedes Arelita

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos aún vive con ella. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Mercedes se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque y también vende en su casa lugar hasta donde llegan muchos de sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, ella compra su mercadería en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viaja cada vez que necesita más prendas, lleva más de 16 años en este negocio y gracias a esto ellos salen adelante cuando la situación es muy difícil.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas y todo tipo de prendas de vestir que ella vende, esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio que hoy le permite salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The loan group Jardín de la Artesanía meets every two weeks in Montecristi, a town known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally renowned crafts. The famous Panama hats are made here.

This is where Mercedes lives. She is 55 years old, married, and has three children from this marriage. They are all adults now, but the youngest still lives with her. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Mercedes works as a merchant, selling all kinds of clothing. She makes her sales door to door, but also at home which many of her customers visit when they need clothing. She leaves her merchandise with her customers on credit and bills them weekly. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil, a city where she travels every time she needs more clothing items. She has been in business for sixteen years. She started it using the first loan she got from her bank, which is why she is very grateful since it allowed her to get through very difficcult times. 

This loan is to purchase pants, blouses, and all sorts of clothing items that she sells. She has been with her communal bank from the start and enjoys it because with the first loan she received from it she started the business that now allows her to get ahead.

Her dream is to have a store to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: Buy pants, blouses, and other kinds of clothing

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is a resident from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of two grown up children. 

She is engaged in a vegetable farming business and in retail sales of milled rice. She is asking for a loan to buy seedlings for the farm and milled rice to sell. 

In the future, Sergia hopes to make her business successful.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for the farm and milled rice to sell

loans.name: Nai's Group

texts.en:
Nai is a villager from the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province and she is 53 years old. She is married and blessed with four children. 

To make a living, she does cashew farming on one hectare of farmland, and she also earns extra income by working as a paid worker. She has been engaged in this business for 34 years and she can earn 30,700 KHR per day. 

This is the first cycle loan for her and her group members with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan of 300,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to pay for labor fees and to buy cassava seedlings for her business. She really hopes that she will gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Savoeun's Group

texts.en:
Savoeun is 55 years old and a resident of Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother of six children, two of whom are still under her care. 

To feed the family and as the main source of income, she has been growing cassava for 37 years. This business earns her 40,000 KHR per day. Savoeun also earns more income from her paid job.  

Now she is seeking a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has formed a group of three. As the leader, she is requesting a loan amount of 300,000 KHR each and she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees. 

She hopes that her cassava field will produce more crop yield on time for her to support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar power system.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es: El señor Juan  tiene 24 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, logro estudiar hasta el nivel de bachillerato, no tiene hijos dependientes de sus ingresos, vive en la casa de sus padres, los cuales trabajan duro para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos menores, el señor les ayuda con algunos gastos como los de alimentación y el pago de servicios. Su principal actividad es la prestación de servicios de transporte de pasajeros en una empresa reconocida en la ciudad de Cochabamba además trabaja en las noches en la prestación de servicios de moto taxi solo para poder llevar un poco de dinero extra a su hogar dado que su padre esta enfermo y no puede trabajar como lo hacia antes, el motivo del presente crédito es para poder comprar una nueva motocicleta porque la que tiene ya esta en deterioro y así podra ofrecer un servicio mas eficiente y lograra llevar el dinero extra a su casa porque les hace mucha falta.
texts.en:
Juan, 24, is a very hardworking person. He managed to study up to the high school level. He does not have any children dependent on his income. He lives with his parents, who work hard to provide for their younger children. Juan helps them with some of the expenses, such as food and utilities. 

Juan's main business activity is providing transport services to passengers for a well-known company in the city of Cochabamba. He also works at night providing motorcycle taxi services so that he can bring some extra money home, as his father is sick and cannot work like he used to.

He will use this loan to buy a new motorcycle because his is in disrepair. He will then be able to offer a more efficient service and he will bring home much-needed extra money.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es: Marvin  vive en la comunidad de buena vista  una  comarca  bastante alejada  del casco urbano de la ciudad, vive con su esposa y su hija de 7 años de edad  la que   tiene estudiando en la escuela de la  comunidad, él se dedica al comercio  tiene  un pequeño negocio  de pulpería en su casa de habitación la  que dice con la ayuda de Dios le va muy bien ya que le permite sacar el gasto de la casa y cubrir otras necesidades , actualmente carecen de no tener luz eléctrica en la comunidad  y el quisiera poder aplicar al trámite de crédito así podría comprar un pequeño sistema solar  para instalarlo en su vivienda lo que le permitirá poder tener su pulpería abierta hasta la noche , esto será de mucho beneficio para su familia y sus vecinos
texts.en:
Marvin lives in a nice village in a region which is relatively isolated from the urban area. He lives with his wife and seven-year-old daughter, who is studying at the village school. 

Marvin works as a merchant. He has a small grocery store located in his home, which he says is going very well thanks to God. He is able to cover the household expenses and other necessities. 

His village currently lacks electric light, so he has applied for a loan to buy a small solar power system which he will install in his home. This will allow him to keep his grocery store open until nighttime, which will be of great benefit to his family and neighbors.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es: Es una mujer jovial, luchadora tiene 61 años de edad, originaria de  Puerto Cabezas, viuda, tiene 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes. Desde hace 3 años sus hijos le establecieron en su vivienda un pequeño negocio de venta de bastimentos y nacatamal. Gracias al apoyo económico de uno de sus hijos que estaba embarcado y al primer financiamiento brindado por PANA PANA hace un año, le permitieron construir un pequeño anexo de madera en punto estratégico cerca de su vivienda e instaurar una pulpería y continuar con la venta de bastimentos y venta de nacatamales de viernes a domingos. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar mercadería: cebolla, tomate, chiltoma, yuca y papa, pan, chivería, huevos, papel higiénico, carbón, pollo, gaseosas, jugos, detergentes, sopas instantáneas, salsa de tomate, toallas sanitarias. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y que su brazo derecho mejore, debido a que en los últimos meses ha presentado problemas de movilidad.
texts.en:
This borrower is a happy, hardworking woman. She is 61 years old and is originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is a widow with four children, all of whom are independent adults.

Three years ago, her children installed a small business in her home to sell general items and Nicaraguan tamales. Thanks to the financial support of one of her children, as well as financial support which she received one year ago from Pana Pana, they were able to construct a small wooden annex in a strategic location near her home where they installed a grocery store. She continues to sell general items and tamales from Friday to Sunday. 

She is applying for her second loan to buy merchandise for her store: onions, tomatoes, yogurt, peppers, yuca, potatoes, bread, yogurt, eggs, toilet paper, coal, chicken, soft drinks, juice, detergent, instant soup, tomato sauce, and sanitary products. Her dream is to grow her business and for her right arm to get better, as she has had mobility problems during the past few months.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store: onions, tomatoes, peppers, yuca, potatoes, bread, yogurt, eggs, toilet paper, coal, chicken, soft drinks, juice, detergent, instant soup, tomato sauce, and sanitary products.

loans.name: Blanca Regina

texts.es:
Blanca Regina tiene 68 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo tienen una bodeguita donde ofrecen variedad de abarrotes leche, azúcar, harina, menestras entre otros, son una familia unida que se apoyan mutuamente, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 600 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca Regina, 68, lives with her husband and children in the district of Cayaltí. The main industries in this community are agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque on the north coast of Peru.

Along with her husband, Blanca Regina has a small grocery store where she offers a variety of grocery items, such as milk, sugar, flour, and dried vegetables. Her family is united and they support each other. She has applied for a loan of 1,600 Peruvian new soles to buy a variety of products to stock her business. She will then generate a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to stock her business.

loans.name: Flor Maribel

texts.es:
Flor Maribel tiene 20 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Chorrillos, una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedican a la destilación de aguardiente, una bebida típica de la sierra del Perú, también se utiliza como un antiséptico y fines curativos, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de caña de azúcar y de esta manera destilar mayor cantidad de aguardiente.
texts.en:
Flor Maribel, 20, lives with her spouse and children in the village of Chorrillos. Her village is in a rural area of the Callayuc district. The main industries in this area are agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located in the province of Cutervo, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

Along with her husband, she makes a living distilling aguardiente, a typical drink in the Peruvian highlands. It is also used as an antiseptic and for medicinal purposes. She has applied for a loan of 2,000 Peruvian new soles to buy a large amount of sugarcane so that she can distill a larger amount of aguardiente.

loans.use: to buy sugarcane to make aguardiente.

loans.name: Ángela Del Rosario

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4  hijos de 22, 18 y 13 años y el menor de 9 meses, los tres menores viven con ella y dos de ellos estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es chofer. 
Doña Ángela es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta  recorriendo su localidad ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, este negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco por lo cual está muy  agradecida ya que así sale adelante. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, entre otras prendas. Lleva desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que tiene en todo este tiempo. Sus sueños aumentar más su negocio.
texts.en:
The Jardín de la Artesanía communal bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi. This area is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its artisan crafts, which are recognized at the national and international level. It is also the home of the famous straw Panama hats. 

Ángela, 39, lives in this area. She is in a common law marriage from which she has four children, ages 22, 18, 13, and nine months. The three younger children live with her. Two of them are studying in high school and primary school. Her husband is a driver.

Ángela is a very hardworking woman who likes to work so that her children do not lack for anything. She makes a living selling all types of clothing. She sells door-to-door, going around her town to offer her products. She sells on credit and collects payments every eight days. She started this business with her first loan from the bank, for which she is very grateful because she is able to move forward.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, and T-shirts, among other items. She has been part of the communal bank since its inception, and she enjoys it because of the benefits she has had during this time. Her dream is to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Guissela Noemi

texts.es:
Guissela Noemi tiene 20 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, desde hace un año, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Guissela Noemi, 20, lives with her husband and children in the district of Buenos Aires. The main industries in this community are agriculture, trade, and livestock. The community is located in the province of Morropon, which belongs to the Piura region on the north coast of Peru.

Guissela Noemi has made a living selling beer for one year. Her business is located in her home. She has applied for a loan of 1,000 Peruvian new soles to buy a larger quantity of beer to offer her clients, thereby generating a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of beer to offer to her clients.

loans.name: Elmeres

texts.es:
Elmeres tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el Caserío Vista Alegre, una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad de clima vairado y bosques verdes, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, dedicándose a este rubro desde hace 3 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elmeres, 27, lives with his wife in the village of Vista Alegre in a rural area of the Callayuc district, which has a varied climate and green forests. It is located in the Cutervo province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

Elmeres makes a living in agriculture, specifically by growing coffee. He has been in this field for three years. His wife helps him with this work. He has applied for a loan of 1,000 Peruvian new soles to buy fertilizer to maintain his coffee crops. He will then have a timely production to offer to his clients.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Jovanny Janeth

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Jovanny, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos  aún vive con ella. Su esposo es jubilado.
Doña Jovanny es maestra de un colegio de la localidad, pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que ella vende en el colegio  donde labora y los fines de semana también  recorre su localidad, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse algo extra por el bienestar de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo además de perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva casi 4 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para su vida. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The "Jardin de la Artesanía" loan group meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, an area known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and for its handicraft products that are known around the country and around the world. It is from here that the famous Panamá hat originates.

And it is here that 53-year-old Jovanny lives. She is married and has four - now adult - children, the youngest of whom still lives at home; Jovanny's husband is retired.

Jovanny is a teacher at a local school but also works selling all types of clothes and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She works every day as she sells at the school where she teaches and at the weekends she also goes around her local town to sell the goods. Jovanny sells on credit, collecting payments every week. She has been doing this work for five years, and it has allowed her to earn a little extra to look after her family's well-being.

This loan will be used to buy clothes, perfumes, creams and cosmetic products. Jovanny has been with the loan group for four years and she likes it because the loans are a great help in her life. Jovanny's dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, creams and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Jaidy Rogelio

texts.es:
Jaidy Rogelio tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Morropon , una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de ladrillo, granos, desde hace 5 años, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de ladrillos al por mayor para luego comercializarlo a un costa más alto y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jaidy Rogelio is 36 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Morropon district, in the Morropon province of the Piura region of Peru's northern coast. Here the people work in farming, cattle-raising and running businesses.

Jaidy has been making a living selling bricks and grains for five years. He has a considerable number of customers. Jaidy has applied for a loan of 2000 Nuevo Soles to buy larger quantities of bricks in bulk, which he can later sell at a higher price. By doing this, Jaidy can earn a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantities of bricks to sell in his local district.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman and a mother of three children who are still attending school. Susana has been earning a living through her sari-sari or retail store for more than 15 years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, biscuits, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her stocks and increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, biscuits, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Carloman

texts.es:
Carloman tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Santa Rosa, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad de clima variado, relieve accidentado y abundante vegetación, su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la ganadería, posee cuatro reses de su propiedad, su ganado vacuno lo cría en sus dos has de inverna , dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 4 años, también se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, tiene una familia unida que le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de un torete para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecerlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Carloman is 31 years old and lives with his wife and children in the village of Santa Rosa, a rural area in the Santo Tomás district in the Cutervo province of the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern highlands. Here the climate is varied, the scenery is mountainous and there is a lot of vegetation. The people here make a living in farming and cattle raising.

Carloman makes a living in cattle-raising. He owns four cows which grows on his two hectares of land. Carloman has been doing this work for four years and he also grows coffee. Carloman has a close family who support him in this work. Carloman has applied for a loan for 20o0 Nuevo Soles in order to buy a small bull to fatten up and later sell for a better price.

loans.use: to buy a small bull to sell later.

loans.name: Edward Miguel

texts.es:
Edward Miguel tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Vista Florida, una zona rural del distrito Santo Tomás, una comunidad de clima variado, con relieve accidentado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de cafeto desde hace 6 años de la variedad catimor, también se dedica a la ganadería, su esposa le apoya en esta labor ordeñando a sus vacas para luego ofrecer la leche fresca a sus vecinos y quesillos que ella misma prepara.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra a jornaleros por el mantenimiento a su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edward Miguel, 24, lives with his wife and children in the village of Vista Florida in a rural area of the Santo Tomás district. This community has a varied climate and a rugged terrain. Its people work in agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located in the province of Cutervo, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He has made a living in agriculture, specifically by growing coffee of the Catimor variety, for six years. He also raises livestock. His wife supports him in his labor by milking the cows to offer fresh milk and cheese which she makes herself to their neighbors.

He has applied for a loan of 2,000 Peruvian new soles from Edpyme Alternative to pay day laborers to maintain his coffee crops. He will then have a timely production to offer to his clients.

loans.use: to pay day laborers to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Ana Lucía

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer pujante y trabajadora de 46 años de edad, casada y madre de 2 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación.
Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo de las confecciones, oficio que aprendió mientras era empleada en diferentes talleres y empresas de confección; gracias a ello, en el año 2005 decidió independizarse y montó su propio taller, prestando servicio de confección a terceros; cuenta con el apoyo de 4 empleados directos y en temporadas altas contrata otras 2 personas; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos básicos del hogar y para velar por la salud de su esposo que quedó con problemas de salud, luego de un accidente de tránsito.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una máquina fileteadora, con la que podrá optimizar el tiempo de trabajo y mejorar la calidad de la producción, logrando fidelizar los clientes y obtener nuevos contratos que significaría aumentar los ingresos.
Ana sueña con consolidar su negocio como un taller versátil y dinámico, que le permita mantener buen nivel de producción durante todo el año y garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar mejor calidad de vida a su esposo y a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is a strong and hard working woman. She is 46 years old, married and has two children, whom she has helped to prosper with effort and dedication.

During her working life, Ana has worked in dressmaking, a trade that she learned when she worked in different workshops and dressmaking businesses. With this experience, in 2005, Ana decided to go it alone and set up her own workshop, offering dressmaking services. Ana has four employees and, in the high season, she hires two other temporary workers. With this work, Ana earns enough to cover basic household costs and to watch out for her husband, who has health problems following a traffic accident.

This loan will be used to buy an overlock sewing machine, with which Ana will be able to optimise her working time and improve the quality of production. This will make customers loyal and she will receive more contracts, thus increasing her income.

Ana dreams of making her workshop dynamic and versatile, allowing her to maintain strong levels of production throughout the year and guaranteeing stable finances. This will allow her to offer her husband and children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en:
Long is a 59-year-old mother of nine children. She lives in the Battambang province where she plants rice for her main source of income. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for six past microloans, which were fully repaid. The past loans have enabled her to provide her family with sufficient food. 

This is her seventh microloan with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and two of her co-borrowers are requesting loans of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland and to pay plowing fees. 

She hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Thoch's Group

texts.en:
Aged 53 years old, Thouch is a rural villager from Battambang province. She is a widowed mother of five children. 

To make a living, she has been farming rice and sometimes she works as a paid worker to better support her family. She has been engaged in this business for 25 years, and it has generated her 35,600 KHR per day. Thouch is the first cycle client with VisionFund. 

Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline, and to pay the fee for pumped water. 

She hopes to increase her income via this business to feed the family on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline, and to pay for the fee for pumped water

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is 44 years old. She is married and has three children. Rano is a very careful mother of her children. She tries to provide her children with a high quality living standard. 

She is going to organize her own business selling children’s clothes. Rano will sell children’s clothes in a local market. She hopes that her business will go well. 

She took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead’, with a women's organization, and got a certificate. 

She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy children’s clothes for organizing the new business. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes for organizing a new business

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha is 40, and she is a mother six children, two of whom are in school. To feed the family, she has been doing rice farming as the main source of income for 20 years. With this business, she can earn 30,000 KHR per day. 

Now she leads a group of three; she is a second cycle client, while her group members are first cycle clients with VisionFund. She is leading her group to seek a loan.  

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for a fee to smooth the land. 

She hopes to gain a good crop yield that is better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay the fee to smooth the land.

loans.name: Arb's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Arb is a 26-year-old mother of three children. Two of her children are in school, the remaining one is too young for schooling. 

To sustain the family, Arb does rice farming as the main source of income and can earn 16,600 Cambodian Riel per day. She has been involved in rice farming for ages.
 
Arb has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to pay for plowing and reaping fees and to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

She hopes that her current business will enable her to upgrade her standard of living and live better than before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and reaping fees and to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Oydin

texts.en:
Oydin was born in 1983. She is married and brings up four children. Her husband Jahongir is a businessman. 

Oydin also wants to start her own business. She is going to start one in animal husbandry. 

Oydin lives in a village and has a good opportunity to develop this kind of business. She took part in a course, To Get Ahead, from a women's organization and got a certificate. 

Now she is ready to start her business but she has no money to buy cattle. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Tajikistan Somoni to buy cattle to launch her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to launch her new business

loans.name: Hotmaida

texts.en:
Hotmaida lives in North of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. Hotmaida manages a small shop selling drinks, snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Hotmaida is married and lives with two persons in the family home.

Hotmaida joined Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Hotmaida sees improvements in her shop. For the last month, she earned an average of $10 to $11 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. Her goal for her business is to expand more in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in North of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. Betty manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Betty is married and lives with five persons in the family home. Betty is seen in the picture with her husband and son.

Betty joined Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Betty sees improvements in her shop.  For the last month, she has earned an average of $89 to $90 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. 

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. Her goal for her business is to expand more in the future

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Theodorins

texts.en:
Theodorins is a 34-year-old man and he is married to Maria, a 32-year-old housewife. They are blessed three children, namely:  Aco, 9, who is in the third grade of elementary school; Janet, 5; and Berlian, 2. 

Theodorins is working as a fireman, but he also runs a public transport/bemo business. He has been involved in the business for three years. Currently, he has two public transport cars and employs two drivers and two conductors. The income from the business averages IDR 6,000,000 each month.

Currently he needs more money to repair and to modify the cars at the repair shop, as most passengers prefer to take a nice bemo. 

Therefore, he requested an individual loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of his public transport cars.

loans.name: Anar

texts.en:
Anar, 25, is a refugee. He is married and has a daughter and a son. His wife is a housekeeper and educates children. The family lives in a settlement for internally displaced persons. 

Anar has been raising seasonal fruits and selling them at a local bazaar for three years. This is the main source of the family’s income. It brings him 150 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) monthly, but he gets additional earnings by working as a labourer in his free time.
 
Refugees from Anar’s region have a high demand for fresh fruits and vegetables. They use fruits to prepare delicious jams for tea and vegetables to cook tasty dishes. They frequent Anar’s grocery stall very often because his fruits are always fresh and tasty. 

After strong winds, Anar’s garden was destroyed and polluted, and many trees were damaged. Anar has applied for a loan of 1,100 AZN to buy fertilizers and garden tools and to rebuild his garden. He needs to increase his income to provide his children with a bright future and a good education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and garden tools and to rebuild his garden.

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi lives in North of Bogor, about 2 hours from Jakarta. Hadi manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Hadi is married and lives with six persons in the family home.

Hadi joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Hadi sees improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he has earned an average of $3 to $4 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  His goal for his business is to expand in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Dewi

texts.en:
Dewi lives in North of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. Dewi manages a small shop selling drinks and mobile phone airtime credit. Dewi is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Dewi joined Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Dewi sees improvements in her shop.  For the last month, she has earned an average of $12 to $13 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. Her goal for her business is to expand in the future

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Rachmat

texts.en:
Rachmat lives in North of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. Rachmat manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Rachmat is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Rachmat joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Rachmat sees improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he has earned an average of $6 to $7 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  His goal for his business is to expand in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Hayati

texts.en:
Hayati lives in North of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. Hayati manages a small shop selling snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credit. Hayati is married and lives with four persons in the family home. In the picture, Hayati is with her husband.

Hayati joined Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Hayati sees improvements in her shop. For the last month, she has earned an average of $10 to $11 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. Her goal for her business is to expand in the future

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia lives in North of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. Amalia manages a small shop selling groceries and mobile phone airtime credit.  Amalia is married and lives with five persons in the family home.

Amalia joined Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Amalia sees improvements in her shop.  For the last month, she has earned an average of $2 to $3  per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  Her goal for her business is to expand in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Fajarudin

texts.en:
Fajarudin lives in North of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. Fajarudin manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Fajarudin is single and lives with three persons in the family home.

Fajarudin joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Fajarudin sees improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he has earned an average of $22 to $23 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  His goal for his business is to expand in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, 39, is married and has children. He describes himself as creative. He operates a retail business selling tiles. He has been involved in this business for four years. 

His business is located in a densely populated area, and his primary customers are local people. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of capital. 

Charles will use this loan of 1,200 Ghanaian Cedi to buy more room tiles to sell to customers. His business goal is to be successful within five years. 

He hopes that, in the future, he will have an improved life.

loans.use: To buy more room tiles to sell to customers.

loans.name: Laxmipriya

texts.en:
Laxmipriya is a 38-year-old widow who lives with her son, age 19 years, in a small village of Odisha, India. Her son goes for schooling in a government school near her house. 

Laxmipriya is engaged in a tailoring business and garments business. Her son helps her in her garment business as well as in her tailoring business as he purchases sewing materials and garments from the big city.

Laxmipriya wants to expand her business, and for that she has applied for a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase a new sewing machine, threads, cloth, etc. She hopes to make more money after this investment and she is thankful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine, threads, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Sikheng's Group

texts.en:
Sikheng, 59, is a married mother of five children and a farmer from Battambang province. She grows rice on eight hectares as her main source of income. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. It has earned her a decent income to support her household. 

This is Sikheng's second micro-loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She now leads a group of three members. As the leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for plowing costs. 

She strongly hopes that her household's standard of living will improve via her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay plowing costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the cooking gas package so that she can cook her food efficiently and without soot.

loans.name: Frady Alberto

texts.es:
Frady es un hombre pujante y trabajador, que desde hace 3 años trabaja en su propio taller de mecánica, oficio que aprendió de manera empírica y con el cual se gana la vida.
El crédito lo solicita como apoyo para comprar repuestos (bujías, juego de luces, retrovisores, frenos), esto le permitirá tener más variedad para satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes y realizar las reparaciones necesarias, con lo que podrá entregar los vehículos de manera oportuna y así generar mejores ingresos por la prestación de sus servicios.
Frady manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio y mejorar la rentabilidad para garantizar un mejor nivel de vida y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Frady is a vigorous and hardworking man, who has worked in his own mechanic workshop for the last three years. This is a trade he learned empirically and with which he makes a living.

He needs the loan for support to buy parts (spark plugs, set of lights, mirrors, brakes). This will allow him to have more variety to satisfy the needs of his customers and carry out necessary repairs. He will be able to turn in the vehicles in a timely manner and thus generate better income for offering his services. Frady says that his greatest desire is to grow his business and improve profitability to guarantee a better level of life and wellbeing for his family.

loans.use: to buy parts (spark plugs, set of lights, mirrors, brakes)

loans.name: Rusli

texts.en:
Rusli lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit. Rusli is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Rusli joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Rusli sees improvements in his shop. For the last month, he has earned an average of $64 - $65 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Imam

texts.en:
Imam lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling toys and mobile phone airtime credit. Imam is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Imam joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credit. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Imam sees improvements in his shop. For the last month, he has earned an average of $4 - $5 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 70 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa tiene una bodeguita donde ofrecen variedad de productos de primera necesidad, sus hijos se desempeñan como jornaleros en las fincas de sus vecinos para apoyar con gastos familiares, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 70, he lives with his wife and children in the district of Querocotillo, a community of varied climate. His people work in agriculture, business and animal husbandry. Located in Cutervo province which belongs to the Cajamarca region, northern sierra of Peru.

Along with his wife, he has a small store where they offer a variety of staple products. Their children work as laborers in the farms of their neighbors to help with family expenses. He has applied for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles for the purchase of a greater quantity of products to offer his clients and, in this manner, generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of products to stock his store.

loans.name: Wiwik

texts.en:
Wiwik lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit. Wiwik is married and lives with five persons in the family home.

Wiwik joined Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credit. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Wiwik sees improvements in her shop. For the last month, she has earned an average of $1 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Yesenia Colombia

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Yesenia, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 21, 18 y 13  años, los menores estudian en colegio y escuela. 
Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección y como es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma instalo un pequeño taller de costura en  su casa,  confecciona ropa deportiva para instituciones educativas de la ciudad y todo tipo de ropa para personas particulares que llegan hasta su casa, sus clientes la conocen por la seriedad y puntualidad para entregar los trabajos razón por lo cual cada día tiene más clientela.
Este crédito es para comprar hilos, telas, cierres y otros materiales de costura  que ella necesita para confeccionar sus prendas. Lleva 7 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Jardin De La Artesania (Garden of the Crafts) meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts, which are recognized nationally and internationally; it is the place of the famous Panama hats. Yesenia lives here. She is 41 years old, a single mother and has three children aged 21, 18 and 13; the two youngest go to school. 
Yesenia learned cutting and tailoring years ago, and because she is a very hard working woman who likes to be self-sufficient, she opened a small sewing workshop in her house. She makes sports clothing for educational institutions in the city and all sorts of clothes for individual customers who come to her workshop. Her customers know her for seriousness and her punctuality in delivering her orders, which is why her clientele increases every day.
This loan is to buy threads, fabrics, fasteners and other sewing materials that she needs to make her garments. She has been in the Communal Bank for seven cycles and she likes it because the loans are a great help. Her dream is that her children finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, fasteners and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Alfonso Berardo

texts.es:
Alfonso Berardo tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población en la mayoría se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café y frutales, comercio de los mismos y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la labores de construcción civil, desempeñándose como maestro de obra, cuenta con clientela en los caseríos aledaños y en su mismo distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles para la compra de herramientas de trabajo palanas, barretas, carretillas y taladros para facilitar su trabajo y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Alfonso Berardo, age 55, lives with his wife and children in the Pucara district, an area with a hot climate where most of the population are engaged in agriculture, particularly growing and selling coffee and fruit and cattle ranching. Pucara is in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region, in the high north of Peru.

Alfonso is in the business of residential construction, working as a master laborer. He has customers in nearby villages and in his own district. He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 600 nuevos soles so that he can buy tools for his job, such as shovels, barricades, wheelbarrows, and drills. These will make his work easier and allow him to provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: purchase tools such as shovels and drills for his construction business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a boar to improve her pig raising and buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a freezer and various stock at wholesale

loans.name: Marianela Isamar

texts.es:
Marianela Isamar tiene 20 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de porcinos desde hace 2 años, en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevo soles para la compra de cerdos pequeños para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marianela Isamar is 20 years old. She lives with her spouse and children in the Morropon district, where most of the residents are in agrictulure, sales, and ranching. Morropon is in the Morropon province, part of the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

For two years now, she has been in the business of raising and selling pigs out of the back part of her home. She is requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevo soles for the purchase of young pigs which she will then fatten and sell at a higher price, earning income for her family.

loans.use: buy young pigs for fattening and sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and lime at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Afqan

texts.en:
Afqan is a 46-year-old, married refugee. He has lived with his wife, a daughter, and two sons in a settlement for internally displaced persons for a long time. His wife is a housekeeper and educates children. Sometimes she helps Afqan with farming. He has been working as a farmer for 22 years, and this is the main source of the family’s income. He raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 300 AZN.

Afqan loves his job very much, and he knows everything about his customers’ demands. He knows that people prefer to buy fresh products from private gardens because they are always fresh and cheap. They like to eat the fruit fresh or make a juice, pie, or jam for tea.

Afqan’s income is too low to cover his cost of living, and it's especially hard for him as a refugee. He has applied for a loan of 1100 AZN in order to buy fertilizers and potentially increase his seasonal harvest. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his earnings from farming and cover all of the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Sothea's Group

texts.en:
Sothea is 29 years old and a villager from the Battambang province. She has two dependent kids; one is in school and the other is not yet school-aged. For the past 12 years, Sothea has been a rice farmer which is the only source of her income. She earns 33,000 KHR per day. Sothea has been with the Kiva partner VisionFund for two past loans that she has fully repaid.

Sothea is the leader of a three-person group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. Sothea hopes to improve her standard of living better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chair, a generator, and to renovate her workplace

loans.name: Juan Julio

texts.es:
Juan Julio tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que `pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su mototaxi, una nueva carpa, espejos y tapizar los asientos y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan Julio is 42, lives with his wife and children in the Oyotún district, a community that works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry. Located in Chiclayo Province, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region, northern coast of Peru.

He provides public transport service in his own mototaxi, carrying his passengers to the surrounding villages of his district. He has applied for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles for the purchase of parts for his mototaxi: a new canopy, mirrors and seat upholstery. In this manner, he will provide a better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy parts for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra is 46 years old and is married with a son. The members of her family are refugees and live in the IDP settlement. She has been growing and selling quince for 24 years. She gets 200 AZn monthly, and this is the main source of the family’s income. Her husband works as a laborer, and this brings them additional earnings. 

Quince is one of the most popular fruits in Azerbaijan. People have high demand for this fruit, especially when they get ill. This fruit is very useful for health and people drink hot milk with dried quince in order to be treated. 

Zohra’s income isn’t high, and she can’t cover all of her family's life costs. She applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN in order to buy and grow other sorts of fruits. She hopes that expanding her fruit assortment will increase her income. As a result, the family will be able to cover their life costs.

loans.use: to buy and grow other kinds of fruits

loans.name: Qabil

texts.en:
Qabil is a 53-year-old refugee. He is married and has two sons. The family lives in an IDP settlement and earns money from gardening. Qabil has been raising fruits (apples, pears, grape and etc.)  for 34 years. He sells them at the local bazaar and gets 230 AZN monthly.

Gardening is one of the most popular professions in Azerbaijan. People have high demand for fresh fruits, and that’s why gardening is so large in our country. People like to eat fruit fresh or use it in preparing different fruit pies and jam. 

Qabil needs money for his sons’ education, but his income is very low for this. He applied for a loan of 1,100 AZN in order to buy new garden tools and fertilizers for his garden. He loves his garden very much and does everything to keep it safe.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Paz

texts.es: Paz de 33 años de edad, vive en casa propia, ella tiene un negocio de Venta de ropa en donde ofrece variedad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, etc. ubicado en una zona muy transitada y conocida por los habitantes. El puesto de ella  es muy visitado ya que las personas siempre encuentran lo que buscan, la amabilidad y el buen trato es lo más importante. Su sueño es ver crecer su negocio por lo que ha decidido hacer un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar más fardos de ropa y tener más variedad de prendas de vestir Como: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisetas, shorts, entre otros. Con el propósito de atraer a más compradores y lograr un mayor nivel de ventas así como un mayor nivel de ingresos.
texts.en: Paz is 33 and lives in a house she owns.  She has a business selling clothing where she offers a variety of items such as skirts, dresses, blouses, pants, etc. Her business is located in a busy traffic and well-known area.  Her business is visited regularly because people always find what they are looking for, her friendly and good service is the most important.  Her dream is to grow the business and she decided to get a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to buy more clothing and have a variety of items such as pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, shorts, and others.  The goal is to attract more customers and achieve a higher volume of sales and a higher level of income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Ikbol

texts.en:
Ikbol is 53 years old and lives with her family in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is a kind woman who has a husband and a son. Ikbol’s husband is a master of house repair. She began her own animal husbandry business 20 years ago and earns additional income from growing agricultural products. Ikbol works hard but it is hardly enough to provide food for her family. 

Ikbol is requesting a loan to buy more cattle. Her loan will help her develop her business and increase the number of cattle and her profit. She will use her loan to improve her living conditions. Ikbol awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Jose Eldys

texts.es:
Jose Eldys tiene 21 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Patacon, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales caprinos desde hace 5 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cabritos para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Jose Eldys is 21 years old and lives with his wife and children in the hamlet of Patacon, a rural area of the district of Pomahuaca. A community with a warm climate, its people make a living in agriculture and commerce and by raising cattle. It is located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region of the northern sierra of Peru.

He has made a living by raising and selling goats for the last five years. His wife helps him in this work; they are a united family that strives in the work that they do. He has asked for a loan for 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to buy baby goats in order to fatten them and then sell them at a better price.

loans.use: to buy baby goats to fatten them and then sell them

loans.name: Salomey

texts.en:
Salomey, 52, has a grocery business. She sells rice, oil, gari (cassava flour), Milo sachets, packets of milk, biscuits, and fruit drinks. She decided to set up a grocery store and offer a variety of products to her regular customers. Her goal is to increase her sales.

Salomey is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, Milo, milk, and fruit drinks. She believes the loan will be very helpful because she will be able to keep items stocked for her customers, with the aim of increasing her income. In the future, she plans to expand the store.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, Milo, milk, and fruit drinks.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is 31 years old and married with a daughter and a son. Along with the rest of his family, he is a refugee. They have lived in a settlement for internally displaced persons for a long time. His wife is a housekeeper and educates children. Elchin has been raising and selling fruits (apples, pears, cherry, apricots, etc.) for 10 years. He has good experience in this field, and his monthly income is 150 AZN.

Azerbaijan cuisine is varied; in particular, there are many different recipes for sweets, jams, compotes, and juices. People like to eat fresh fruits or use them to prepare sweet dishes. 

Elchin’s income doesn’t allow him to cover his cost of living. He has applied for a loan of 1100 AZN in order to buy vegetable seeds so he can raise them, too. He decided to expand his business in hopes of increasing his income.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is a 23-year-old old single man who is a refugee and lives with his parents in an IDP settlement. For the last two years, he has been working as a gardener and selling different fruits and vegetables. Elnur has good experience in this field and his monthly income is 200 AZN. His mother is a housekeeper and his father earns additional money for the family by working as a driver.

Gardening is one of the largest professions because there is a high demand for fruits and vegetables. Fruits from private gardens sell more quickly than fruit in the market because they are always fresh and cheap. That’s why Elnur’s grocery is one of the most popular groceries in region. 

Elnur is requesting a 1,100 AZN loan to buy new fertilizer and enlarge his harvest. His mother is weak and she needs money to get a long treatment. Elnur will increase his gardening income and provide her medication.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and expand his harvest

loans.name: Fabio

texts.es:
Fabio tiene 27 años, vive con sus  padres y hermanos en la Ciudad de Paraguarí, es macatero (vendedor ambulante) con más de cinco años de experiencia, trabaja casi todos los días de la semana. Es un señor muy conocido en la zona por su sacrificio, humildad y ganas de trabajar. 
Solicitó el préstamo para la compra de ropas y utensilios para la cocina en general, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y luchando por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Fabio is 27 years old. He lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Paraguarí. He is a macatero (a street vendor) with more than five years' experience. He works almost every day of the week. He is a very well known man in the area for his sacrifice, humility and eagerness to work. 

He asked for the loan to buy clothing and kitchen utensils for general cooking, so that he can keep working and striving to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan is 24-year-old, married refugee. He has a son, and the family lives in a settlement for internally displaced persons (IDPs). His wife is a housekeeper and raises their child. For three years, Elshan has been working as a gardener, raising and selling fruits. This small business brings him 160 AZN monthly.

Elshan is a very responsible and hardworking man. He has good experience and knows everything about his customers’ demands. People in IDP settlements are poor, and they try to buy fruits as cheaply as possible. They use fruits to prepare juice, jam, or pies.

Elshan’s income is low, and it doesn’t allow him to meet his family’s needs. He has applied for a loan of 1100 AZN in order to buy fruit tree seeds and fertilizers. This will expand his small business and hopefully increase his income. So let’s help Elshan!

loans.use: to buy fruit tree seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y muy humilde, cada dia lucha para poder salir adelante, y por medio de su esfuerzo lo esta logrando. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas y accesorios femeninos y masculinos, y su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder comprar ropas para damas y también de accesorios, con lo cual pudo trabajar y mejorar sus ventas.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en prendas varias para la venta, además de accesorios para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Laura is a very hardworking, responsible and humble person. Each day, she fights to be able to get ahead, and by her effort she is achieving. She says that she makes her living selling clothing and male and female accessories. She used her previous loan to be able to buy women's clothing and also accessories, with which she could work and improve her sales.

Today, she applies for this loan to be able to invest it in various clothing and accessories for selling, and in this manner, be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy various clothing and accessories for selling.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Aminata. She is single and has 2 children ages 25 and 16. In 1992, Aminata established her ladies' dress, men's suit and children's wear business. She began her business because she realized the benefits of doing business. Her business is located in city centre and her main customers are the public. She opens her business 7 days a week and 10 hours a day. 

Aminata would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy ladies' and men's clothing for her business. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase the size of the business. In the future, Aminata plans to buy bikes for commercial purposes, which will generate more profit and increase the size of the business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more ladies' and men's clothing

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de María tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y gnadeía, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y aguadito desde hace seis años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mesas y sillas para arreglar su local y de esta manera atender a mayor cantidad de clientes generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Flor de María is 41, she lives with her partner and children in the Oyotún disrtrict, a community that works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry. Located in Chiclayo Province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru.

She has been working selling hot dogs, french fries and stew for the past six years. Her business is located in the back part of her home. She has applied for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles for the purchase of tables and chairs to fix up her business. In this manner, she will tend to a greater quantity of customers, generating better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to fix up her business.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café y frutales, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos,una carpa, llantas entre otros para seguir brindado un servicio seguro a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Alberto is 32 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Pucará, a community with a warm climate. The people there make a living from agriculture, especially from the cultivation of coffee and fruit, commerce and raising cattle. It is located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region of the northern sierra of Peru.

He provides public transport service in his own mototaxi, taking his passengers to the hamlets adjacent to his district. He has requested a loan for 800  Peruvian nuevos soles to buy replacement parts, a shade and tires, among other items, in order to keep providing a safe service to his passengers.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and a shade for his vehicle

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 46 years old and lives in Accra-Teshie city in Greater-Accra region. She is married and has two children; she lives with her husband and children. 

Felicia’s husband works as a mason. Felicia sells customers wigs and secondhand clothing. Despite the effort made by her husband, Felicia’s financial support from her small business is great. She has been doing this business for 21 years and still counting. She says that she has a number of loyal customers who do shopping from her stall regularly.

loans.use: To buy wigs and secondhand clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Kenia Vanessa

texts.es: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada, tiene 2 niñas de 4 años y una pequeña de 6 meses respectivamente. Desde hace 5 años ha vivido de manera inestable con su familia, ya que aún recuerda que cada seis meses tenía que buscar una vivienda con precio accesible a su salario para alquilarla, pagando una mensualidad de US$ 120 incluidos servicios básicos. Sin embargo, con el sueño de tener su propia vivienda y vivir de manera segura, ha luchado por construir su casita de concreto, hace 2 años compró en conjunto con su esposo con sus ahorros y aguinaldo su terreno y con el primero financiamiento otorgado por PANA PANA, le permitió comprar materiales para su vivienda: bloques, cemento, hierro, arena fina, arena gruesa, madera, zinc y clavos. Actualmente solicita su segundo financiamiento para iniciar la estructura de su vivienda de concreto, la cual tendrá un tamaño de 47 pies x 57 pies, dos cuartos y la fosa séptica para el baño. Su sueño es contar con una vivienda que le brinde las comodidades a su familia, instalarle el techo, compactar el suelo para construir el piso,  instaurarle las ventanas, puertas, verjas y  establecer su propia fuente de ingresos a través de un negocio con el propósito de velar por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Kenia comes from Puerto Cabezas.  She is 28 years old and married.  She has two girls, ages 4 years and 6 months, respectively.  

For the past five years she has lived in an unstable way with her family.  She still remembers that every six months she would have to look for a new house with a price that she could manage with her salary in order to rent it, paying a monthly rent of 120 U.S. dollars, including utilities.  Nevertheless, it was her dream to have her own home and live securely.  She has struggled to build her house out of concrete.  

Two years ago, together with her husband she bought a plot of land using savings and a pay bonus.  With the first loan that Pana Pana granted her, she was able to buy materials for her home: concrete blocks, cement, iron, fine and coarse sand, wood, corrugated roofing, and nails.  

Now she is asking for a second loan to begin the structure of her house with concrete.  It will have a size of 47 feet by 57 feet, with two rooms and a septic tank for the bathroom.  

Her dream is: to have a house that provides her family with comforts, to install the roof, to compact the ground in order to install a floor, to install windows, doors, and railings, and to establish her own source of income through a business, with the goal of safeguarding the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to build her home out of concrete, with two rooms and a septic tank for the bathroom.

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
Rashad is a 28-year-old refugee. He is married and has a daughter. His wife is a housekeeper and the family lives in an IDP settlement. The head of the family has earned money raising fruits and vegetables for 4 years. His monthly income is 150 AZN. 

Azerbaijan people like eating fresh fruits and vegetables. They use fruits to prepare jam for tea and cook delicious dishes from vegetables. Rashad raises fruits and vegetables in the backyard of his house and then sells them at a local bazaar.

Rashad's earnings aren’t enough to cover his family’s needs. He applied for an 1,100 AZN loan in order to supply and sell other sorts of fruits at the bazaar in addition to the ones that he grows himself.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Lagunayta Poty Group

texts.es:
Lagunayta Poty  se formó con mucho esfuerzo y hoy ya  se encuentran en el 5 ciclo, trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa de comité de mujeres. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta.
Una historia muy conmovedora  es la de la Sra. Salustiana  quien se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo de productos. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante,  día a día trabaja desde muy tempranas horas y de esa forma lucha para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
