Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas, carne, pollo, bebidas, enlatados y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo, y luchando por mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Lagunayta Poty was formed with great strength and today already finds itself in its 5th cycle, working jointly and separately within the womens' committee program. In addition to the independent work of each woman, they also develop joint activities. 

One very moving story is that of Sra. Salustiana, who is dedicated to sales, since she has a well-stocked pantry with all types of products. She is a very selfless woman who, with much strength, is coming out ahead. Each day she works beginning in the early hours, and in this way she fights to be able to help her family by way of her work. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of vegetables, fruits, meat, chicken, beverages, canned goods and more, and this way will be able to continue working as she has been doing, and fighting to improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, meat, chicken, beverages, canned and extra products.

loans.name: Milagros Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Milagros está integrado por 18 mujeres, quienes  están en el  ciclo numero 2do del programa de comité de mujeres, donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas han podido mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del trabajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien es de profesión peluquera, es una persona muy buena en lo que hace, y es por eso que le va muy bien y se ha hecho de muy buena clientela. Ella está luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
La Sra.  Maria  pide este préstamo para la compra de productos en general para su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues y demás insumos , lo que le ayudará a tener y concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Milagros is made up of 18 women. They are in their 2nd cycle in the women's committee program. They are participating in a poverty elimination survey, and all of them have been able to improve their quality of life through work.  

One of the members is Maria. She is a hair stylist by profession. She is a person who is very good at what she does. That is why is has gone very well for her and she has a good clientele. She is fighting to improve her quality of life and to help her family through her work. 

Maria is asking for this loan to buy general products for her hair salon, such as dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and other materials. This will help her to have and firm up her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and other materials.

loans.name: Vidalia

texts.es:
Vidalia es una mujer muy trabajadora que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo esta saliendo adelante, se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas de damas, caballeros y niños. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Vidalia comenta que su préstamo anterior lo utilizó en la compra de prendas de temporada, con lo cual pudo mejorar bastante. Hoy pude un nuevo préstamo que quiere usar en comprar prendas variadas para poder seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Vidalia is a very hardworking woman who is getting ahead with a lot of sacrifice and effort. She makes a living by selling a variety of clothing for women, men and children. She is a woman who strives a lot and wants to improve her family's living conditions.

Vidalia says that she used her previous loan to buy seasonal clothing, and that she was able to improve her situation quite a bit. She is currently asking for a new loan that she wants to use to buy a variety of clothing in order to keep growing as she has been.

loans.use: to buy clothing for the upcoming fall season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Bakisatu

texts.en: This is 26-year-old Bakisatu. In 2009, Bakisatu established her local foodstuffs business, selling garri (tapioca), groundnuts, bennie (sesame), pepper, palm oil, and other items. She began her business because she wanted to help reduce the poverty rate in her family. She operates her business 7 days a week and 10 hours a day. Bakisatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy garri, groundnuts, bennie, pepper, and palm oil from the farmers in the villages. She hopes that this loan will help her earn more profit to help support her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food like garri and bennie

loans.name: Santo Rey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santo Rey está en su 6° ciclo  sexto, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
La Sra. Maria, presidenta del grupo tiene 35 años, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora  y capaz de liderar un grupo numeroso como lo es este, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación. Ella se dedica a las ventas varias, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar azúcar, fideos, carne, leche, panificados, arroz, bebidas, aceite, harina, etc., para poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Santo Rey group is in its 6th cycle, where all work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing a poverty elimination survey, where 6 of them are found below the poverty line, which means they have very low incomes.

Maria, president of the group, is 35. She is a very hardworking woman and capable of leading a numerous group like this one. During all of these cycles, she has demonstrated a desire to excel. She works selling various things, and is applying for this loan to be able to buy sugar, noodles, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, drinks, oil, flour, etc., to be able to continue with her sales. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, drinks, oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es:
Gricelda está estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas para ayudar a su familia, ya que ellos son de escasos recursos.
Comenta que con mucho sacrificio está luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y de esa forma estar más cerca de su meta.
texts.en: Gricelda is studying Business Administration to help her family, since they are of scarce resources. She says that with much sacrifice, she is fighting to improve her living conditions, and those of her loved ones. She is applying for this loan to be able to invest it in paying her tuition installments and, in this manner, be closer to her goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer trabajadora y activa, a sus 54 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo hace varios años.
Durante su vida productiva trabajó como empleada en diferentes empresas de la ciudad, pero desde hace 18 años decidió independizarse y comenzó a hacer tejidos bordados para vender entre sus familiares y amigos, además complementa sus ingresos con la venta de productos por catálogo, trabaja sola todos los días de 10 am a 6 pm y así ha logrado generar los recursos para solventar los gastos familiares.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de surtido al por mayor (perfumería, cosméticos, accesorios, ropa) esto le permitirá tener más variedad de productos disponibles para ofrecer a sus clientes, mejorando las ganancias que obtiene por su labor.
Francisca manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es montar una empresa de confecciones grande, bien estructurada que le permita generar oportunidades de empleo y mejorar las condiciones de vida y bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Francisca is a hardworking and active woman, who, at the age of 54, is the mother of 4 children and head of the household, as she has been separated from her husband for several years. 

Over the course of her working life she has been employed by different companies in the city, but 18 years ago she decided to become independent, and she began making embroidered textiles to sell among her relatives and friends.  Additionally, she supplements her income with the sale of catalog products, working alone every day from 10 a.m. until 6 p.m., and thus she has managed to generate the resources to pay for the family’s expenses. 

She will invest the loan that she is seeking in the purchase of wholesale merchandise (perfumes, cosmetics, accessories, and clothing), which will allow her to have a greater variety of products available to offer her customers, thus improving the earnings that she obtains from her labor.

Francisca reveals that her greatest desire is to open a very big and well-organized dressmaking business that would generate employment opportunities and improve the living conditions and well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale merchandise (perfumes, cosmetics, accessories, and clothing).

loans.name: Mukama Yemubeezi Kisunku Group

texts.en:
Teddy thanks Kiva lenders for contributing towards her group's previous loan. She was able to use her portion of the loan to increase her monthly profits from 300,000 UGX to 450,000 UGX. Teddy used the profit from her loans to help pay tuition for her two children. 

Dinah, also a member of this group, will use her portion of this current loan to pay tuition for her daughter at a tertiary institution. Exams are due in a short time, but her daughter apparently has no money. Dinah’s loan will save her daughter from missing her exams. She thanks the group members for their support and Kiva lenders for their partnership.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian es una mujer muy emprendedora, que está esforzándose por salir adelante, es estudiante de la carrera de Ciencias Económicas, y está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo por ser una profesional para ayudar a las demás personas.
Comenta que su inspiración es su familia ya que por ellos lucha ya que quiere ayudarlos a tener una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y sus gastos de transporte, ya que le hace mucha falta y quiere seguir luchando por sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Mirian is a very enterprising woman, who is pushing herself to get ahead. She is a student in Economic Sciences, and is putting forth her best effort to be a professional to help other people.

She says that her inspiration is her family, since she fights for them. She wants to help them have a dignified live without hardship. She is applying for this loan to be able to invest it in the payment of her tuition payments and transportation costs, since she is lacking a lot and wants to continue fighting for her goals.

loans.use: to pay tuition and transportation costs.

loans.name: Activistas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama activistas unidas, donde las 17 mujeres están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus vidas por medio del trabajo en equipo. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Dalila quien al entrar al grupo se encontraba por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, pero a través del esfuerzo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, sumado a su trabajo de manicura y pedicura casa por casa hace está mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Dalila pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en esmaltes, alicates, corta uñas, limas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, con lo que podrá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called “United Activists,” with 17 women putting forth their best efforts to improve their lives by means of working as a team. They are making an attempt to eliminate poverty.

One of the activists is Dalila who upon joining the group, was found to be below the poverty line, but after the effort and application of the vital comportment of a successful woman, together with her work as a manicurist and pedicurist door to door, she  achieved  improvement of her conditions of life.

Dalila is requesting this loan to be able to invest in nail polish, nail clippers, nail files, and other inputs, and in this way, to continue offering good service to her customers.

Dalila is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to enable her to continue growing.

loans.use: buy nail polish, pliers, nail clippers, nail files and other supplies.

loans.name: Las Guapas Group

texts.es:
Las Guapas se llama este grupo donde cada una de las integrantes está luchando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Wilma, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación.
Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que es costurera y que tiene siempre mucho trabajo y es por eso que le va muy bien, ya que sus clientes siempre están muy conformes con su trabajo. Su sueño es poder tener un taller grande donde algún día pueda dar trabajo a otras personas.
La Sra. Wilma solicita de este préstamo para la compra de telas e hilos, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“The Beautiful Women” is the name of this group where each one of the members is battling to improve her condition of life. One of the members is Wilma, who by her efforts and continuous work, and the application of the principals of the vital comportment of a successful woman, is improving her situation.

Among the work that she does is dressmaking. Wilma always has a quantity of this work, and it is for that reason that things are going very well, since customers always like her work very much.

Wilma's dream is to be able to have a large shop where some day, she can offer work to other persons.

Wilma is requesting a loan to purchase cloth and thread, which will help her to make a concrete business plan, and will help improve her income.

loans.use: buy cloth and thread for dressmaking.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La  señora Maria tiene 48 años y está Casada con la señor Genaro quien tiene 54 años, ellos tienen hijos, por quienes están luchando para poder sacarlos adelante.
La señora Maria, cuando vivía con sus padres aprendió el negocio de la carnicería con su padre, luego cuando se casó siguió trabajando con su padre hasta que pudo independizarse.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de animales vacunos para faenar y satisfacer la demanda de su clientela. Agradece por esta oportunidad de seguir trabajando y luchando por salir adelante.
texts.en: Maria is 48 years old and is married to Genaro, who is 54 years old. They have children, for whom they are striving in order to get them ahead in life. When Maria lived with her parents, she learned the business being a butcher from her father. Then when she married she kept working with her father until she was able to become independent. She is asking for the loan to buy cattle to slaughter in order to satisfy her customers' demands. She is grateful for this opportunity to keep working and striving to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy cattle to slaughter

loans.name: Sani

texts.es:
Sani tiene 39 años, está casada con el Sr. Cirilo, tienen 3 hijos todos están estudiando, gracias al sacrificio que esta pareja está haciendo.
Ella tiene un taller de costura, donde tiene 6 personales en forma permanente, tiene una clientela formada y trabaja para conocidas empresas, además tiene su propio taller de serigrafía y de esa forma preparar los logos de las prendas a entregar. Manifiesta que su  profesión la heredó ya que desde muy joven trabajaba en un taller de costura, donde adquirió experiencia y luego de ahorrar un tiempo compró para sus primeras 2 máquinas, hasta renunciar y formar su propio taller.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en una máquina de coser para poder seguir trabajando y luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Sani is 39 years old and is married to Cirilo. They have three children, all of whom are studying thanks to the sacrifices that this couple is making. She has a sewing workshop, where she has six permanent staff. She has an established clientele and works for well-known businesses. She also has her own silk-screening workshop and that is how she prepares the logos for the clothing that she is going to deliver. She says that she inherited her profession, as she worked in a sewing workshop from the time she was very young, where she gained experience. After saving up for a while, she bought her first two machines, until she was able to quit and start her own workshop. She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in buying a sewing machine in order to keep working and striving as she has been.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Sarifali

texts.en:
Sarifali is a 58-year-old refugee. He is married and has a son and three daughters. His wife is a housekeeper and the family lives in IDP settlement. He has grown and sold fruit for 35 years. This is the main source of income and he earns 230 AZN monthly. He earns additional income working as a veterinarian and treating livestock. 

Sarifali loves his job very much. He takes care of trees during the year and doesn’t let them become damaged. He knows peoples’ demands and tries to raise fresh and tasty fruits. People like to visit his grocery and buy fresh fruit.

Sarfali’s family is very big and his income isn’t enough to cover life's demands. He applied for 1,100 AZN to buy new garden tools. He wants to keep his garden in good conditions all the time because a good harvest brings high income.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of cement and rice.

loans.name: Evely Lizbets

texts.es:
Evely vive en la ciudad de Nazca, es una joven muy carismática y trabajadora, sobre todo porque apoya a sus padres con algunos gastos del hogar, cada día se esfuerza mucho, en su empleo, ella trabaja actualmente en una pollería de su ciudad alrededor de 8 horas al día, lo cual le permite poder tener ingresos para salir adelante.

Evely esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ese apoyo ella podrá solventar algunos gastos personales y también algunas mejoras en la habitación donde vive, así podrá seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Evely lives in the city of Nazca. She is a very hardworking and charismatic young woman who helps her parents meet their household expenses. Evely works diligently for eight hours each day at her job in a poultry shop in Nazca, earning an income that allows her to improve her situation.  

Evely is grateful to Kiva lenders as their support will allow her to cover some personal expenses and also defray the cost of some improvements to her family's home. A Kiva loan will also allow her to keep working and striving to realize her great ambition: to have her own business.

loans.use: pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Tenneh.  She is married and has 3 children who are 18, 15 and 9 years old. 

In 2002, Tenneh established a business to sell beer, stout, batteries, facial tissues, pure water and provisions.  She began her business to help her husband to take care of the home and children. Her business is located in the outskirts of town and her main customers are the general public. 

She works 7 days a week,11 hours a day to earn 500,000 SLL every month.  She also gets support from her husband and being thrifty in her business. She would like 5,000,000 SLL to buy cartons of stout, beer, bundles of pure water, and provisions. She hopes that this loan will allow  her to increase stock, get more customers, and realize more sales and profits. 

In the future, Tenneh plans to see her eldest child gain admission to the university.   Fees will be paid from profits raised. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and provisions for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulk supplies of jeans and textiles.

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en:
Teymur is a 34-year-old married man with two sons. His wife is a housekeeper and educates children. This  family are refugees and they live in IDP settlement. Teymur is a gardener. He raises potatoes, greens, onions, and tomatoes to sell at a local bazaar. Sometimes, he raises poultry but the main source of income is gardening. He earns 190 AZN monthly. 

Raising vegetables is expanding in Azerbaijan because people buy fresh vegetables and use them to cook different delicious dishes. They used vegetables to cook kuku, lobya, chighirtmasi, pity, and bora. 

Teymur wants to expand his business in order to increase his income. He plans to raise and sell not only vegetables but fruit. He applied for 1,100 AZN in order to grow fruit trees and sell the crops.

loans.use: to supply and sell fruit.

loans.name: Miryan

texts.es:
La Señorita. Miryan tiene 33 años y está casada y estudia el 4to. año de enfermería y le falta 1 año para terminar su carrera.
Miryan vive con su mama que tiene una mercería y le ayuda para atender el negocio. Su aspiración es terminar su carrera de Licenciatura en Enfermería, para poder trabajar en un hospital público y más adelante abrir en su casa su propio consultorio.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus cuotas, lo que le permitirá seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Miryan is 33 years old and she is married.  She is studying in her fourth year of nursing, and she will complete her degree in one year. Miryan lives with her mother, who has a notions shop, and she helps her to look after the business. 

Her goal is to complete her nursing degree in order to work in a public hospital, and in the future, open her own clinic in her home. She is requesting this loan in order to pay college tuition, which will allow her to continue studying as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay college tuition.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Abdulai.  He is married and has 4 children who are 15,12, 9 and 4 years old. 

In 2004, Abdulai started a business to sell video cassette and drinks. He began his business because he was trained to be a  business man. He works 7 days a week, 8 hours a day to earn 700,000 SLL each month. 

He would like 4,000,000 SLL to buy more video cassettes and a variety drinks to sell. In the future, Abdulai plans to expand his business. He is a hard worker.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more video cassettes and a variety of drinks.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 45 years old, separated and the mother of two children who are 13 and 16 years old. She has two additional dependents who live with her in order to complete their education. In 2004, Mary established a business where she sells shoes, bags, shirts, jeans, sneakers, bowls and food containers. She began her business to be self reliant after being devastated by a war. Her business is located on the outskirts of town and most of her customers are people who live nearby. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,644,650 every month and is requesting a loan for Le 5,000,000. Mary has already received and successfully repaid three prior loans, and now requires a new loan in order to have more items to sell. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her store and increase her profits. In the future, she plans to expand her business to the city center. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional kitchen utensils and baby supplies for resale.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr Sidikie

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Abu Bakarr.  He is married and has one child, aged four. In 2010, Abu Bakarr established his business, selling DVDs, VCDs, and phone recharging and top-up services. He began his business to become self-reliant after dropping out of school. His business is located at the city center and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,036,000 every month from this business. 

Abu Bakarr has already received and successfully repaid 1 previous loan. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000 in order to buy recharge cards, VCDs, and DVDs. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his stock and expand the business. In the future, Abu Bakarr plans to improve the business and expand to other areas of the town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase DVDs and recharge vouchers.

loans.name: Thaimu

texts.en: This is 29-year-old Thaimu.  He is married and has one child, aged four. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him in order to help his brother get his education. In 2004, Thaimu established his used clothing business in order to become self-reliant after dropping out of school. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,205,500 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000 to buy used men's suits. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his stock and expand the business. In the future, Thaimu plans to improve the business and expand into a shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for his shop

loans.name: Sandra Mariela

texts.es:
Quiere contar la historia de Sandra, ella es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora, con deseos de progresar y salir  adelante con los dos hijos, los cuales ha logrado sacar  por medio del trabajo honesto, es una persona organizada, que cumple con las labores y requerimientos que se le soliciten, es capaz de liderar y solucionar problemas rápidamente, posee valores como la responsabilidad honestidad, servicio hacia los demás y compromiso con los objetivos entre otros, dentro de las fortalezas presenta deseos de superación y gusto por el trabajo en equipo, se considera una persona con alta capacidad de absorber conocimientos teóricos y prácticos, facilidades para la comunicación y comprensión ante lo que le deseen comunicar, así mismo se distingue por las excelentes relaciones humanas y disposición para la colaboración. 
La motivación mas grande para ella son los dos hijos y por ello ella quiere estudiar y capacitarse para progresar, brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a través del ejemplo de cómo nunca es tarde para estudiar y que se puede con muchos deseo y amor ser una persona más capacitada.

Sueña con el tiempo obtener la propia empresa para así mejorar los ingresos y brindarles la oportunidad a otras personas de trabajo.

De antemano agradece la colaboración y espera contar con el apoyo, ya que kiva muy amablemente le colaboraran para este semestre en el cual se encuentra que es el tercero, ya que para ella es muy importante terminar y cumplir la meta.
texts.en:
Sandra is an enterprising and determined woman with a desire to progress and get ahead in life with her two children, by means of honest work. She is an 
organized person, who fulfills her duties and requirements. She has a capacity to lead and solve problems quickly. She has values such as responsibility, honesty, service to others and a compromise towards her goals. Among her strengths, she has a desire to improve and likes to do team work. Sandra defines herself as a person with high capacity to absorb theoretical and practical knowledge, an easiness to communicate and understand what others want to communicate. She is also excellent at human relations and has a disposition to collaborate.
Sandra's biggest motivations are her two children. That is why she wants to study and get a degree, in order to get ahead and provide better quality of life for them through the example of how it is never too late to study and how, with a lot of effort and love, one can become a better qualified person.
Sandra dreams of opening her own business with time and thus improve her income and provide job opportunities for other people. She is grateful in advance for the collaboration and hopes to get the support needed, since Kiva is kindly collaborating this school semester, her third one. It is very important for her to finish her studies and achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay one semester of tuition fees.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has 2 children who are 8 and 3 years old. 

In 2004, Mohamed started a business to sell  provisions. He began his business because he was trained as a business man. He works 7 days a week, 15 hours a day to earn 700,000 SLL each month. 

He would like 3,000,000 SLL to buy more provisions to sell. In the future, Mohamed plans to expand his business to earn more profit. He is a hard worker.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more provisions.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has 2 children who are 18 and 5 years old. 

In 2004, Mohamed established his Pharmacy/Drug Store business. He began his business because he was trained as a business man. He works 7 days a week, 13 hours a day to earn 1,600,000 SLL each month. 

He would like 5,000,000 SLL to buy pharmacy drugs and cosmetics. In the future, Mohamed plans to educate his children and to build a house. He works very hard and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy pharmacy drugs and cosmetics to  resell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Margaret.  She is married and has a  2 year old child. 

In 2009, Margaret established a business to sell provisions and drinks. She began her business because she wants to assist her husband in taking care of the home. She works 7 days a week, 8 hours a day to earn 800,000 SLL each month. 

She would like 4,000,000 SLL to buy provisions and a variety of drinks. In the future, Margaret plans to educate her children at the university level.. She is a very hard worker.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy provisions and a variety of drinks.

loans.name: Momodu

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Momodu, who is married and the father of three children aged 2, 8 and 11. In 2003, he established a business selling provisions, toiletries and drinks. He began his business just to be self reliant after working for his late brother. His business is located on the outskirts of town and his main customers are people who live nearby. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 731,000 every month and is requesting a loan for Le 3,500,000. Momodu has already received and successfully repaid two previous loans, and will use this new one to buy more items to sell to his customers, including drinks, toothpaste, sardines and milk. He hopes that this loan will increase his inventory and his income. In the future, he plans to improve his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy eggs,rice and other provisions.

loans.name: Sento M.

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Sento. She is married and has three children aged 7, 9, and 12 years. All are school-going children. 
	
In 2008, Sento established her mayonnaise, Ovaltine, milk, air freshener, luncheon meat, onions, rice, and sugar business. She began her business because she didn't attend school because her parents did not value girls' education. Her mother only introduced her to business. 

When she got married, her husband gave her some amount of money to start a business. Working seven days a week and fifteen hours a day, she earns about 1,800,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Sento would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy flour,  sugar, rice, soap, and sachet (packaged) milk.
 
In the future, Sento hopes to build a shop. The loan will help her to generate more income and improve her family's standard of living.  She is hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: to buy flour,  sugar, rice, soap, and sachet milk

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Aminata.  She is married and has 2 children who are 17 and 22 years old. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her.  

In 2007, Aminata established a building and cooking supplies business. She began her business because it yields a high profit.   She works 7 days a week, 6 hours a day to earn 1, 000,000 each month. 

She would like 5, 000,000 SLL to buy large quantities of building and cooking supplies. In the future, Aminata plans to educate her children at the university level.

loans.use: to buy building and cooking supplies.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 24-year-old Mohamed. He is married, and has no child. In 2007, Mohamed established his electronic items business. He began his business because he was not too educated. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid his first loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy more electronics of different kinds to resell. In the future, Mohamed plans to expand his business for more development. He is very hardworking, and he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more electronics of different kinds to resell.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 8 group leader farmers in the Kakamega North District. Judith has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 89 other individual farmers belonging to this group. They will each receive the necessary materials to plant ¼-acre of maize and ¼-acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings apiece.

Judith is a reliable member of the community. She is married with five children. Judith is 37 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last ten years to support her family. In addition to this, Judith is very active in her community and is involved in the women's group and prayer group. She hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success she is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.	

Judith is now enrolling for the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Judith joined One Acre Fund so that she could learn new farming methods. Because she wants to help more farmers and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Judith has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. In the future, Judith hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school and buy a cow.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers. Judith and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover the initial cost of purchasing the package of seeds and fertilizer from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives. 

Please note that there are 4 additional group leaders in this photo who will be working with One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan. The field officer is included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarette, drinks, pure water, and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Hudson's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of eight group leader farmers in Kakamega North District, with Hudson selected as the Kiva representative. Hudson has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. 

Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 90 other individual farmers represented and the leaders that represent them in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant one-quarter acre of maize and one-quarter acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 Kenyan shillings each. 

Hudson is a reliable member of the community. He is married with eight children. Hudson is 61 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 38 years to support his family. In addition to this, Hudson is very active in his community and is involved in the prayer group. He described his harvest last year as good. He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.	 

Hudson joined One Acre Fund in 2013 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods and earn enough to feed his family. As an active member in his community, Hudson also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member who wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. 

Hudson plans on using future profits from the harvest to send children to school and save for the future. His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more farm group support and was able to feed the family. Hudson is also involved in the community's school committee. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Hudson and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. 

One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	 

Please note that there is one additional group leader in this photo who will be working with One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva group loan. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
DANAYA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de SELINGUE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne  quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de poisson à l’image de NASSOU qui est la deuxième personne  debout de la droite vers la gauche   de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à SELINGUE dans la  Préfecture de YANFOLILA (Région de Sikasso, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de poissons. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a cinq ans. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
NASSOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à SELINGUE, excelle dans la vente de poissons. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de poissons.  Elle s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes  de SELINGUE, KANGARE et DALABALA et vend ses poissons à SELINGUE en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de poissons.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group in the Benkadi de Selingue association. It is composed of women who know each other from family and neighborhood ties. They are married and, on average, 31 years old with four children. They live in large traditional families in Selingue, Yanfolila (Sikasso region, in the Republic of Mali).

The group members, like Nassou, who is standing second from the right in the photo, engage in different kinds of business, especially the buying and selling of fish. They have been in this type of small-scale commerce for several years and are highly sought-after.

In order to meet the growing need of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso's loan program five years ago. They are on their sixth group loan.

Nassou is the leader of the group and is well-known in Selingue, where she excels at selling fish. She plans to use her loan to buy a large amount of fish. She procures the fish from wholesalers in Selingue, Kangare, and Dalabala, and makes her sales in Selingue at retail for cash and credit to a mixed group of customers. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA which will allow her to pay back the loan and to reinvest in her business of selling fish.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 53-year-old married woman with a daughter and a son. Her  family are refugees living in IDP settlement. Her husband works as a laborer, but the main source of family’s income is farming. Tahira has grown fruit trees and sold fruit for 33 years. She has good skills and knows everything about gardening. Her monthly income is 200 AZN.

The demand for fresh fruits is high because Azerbaijanians like eating and cooking with fruits fresh.  They prepare juice, jam, pies and compote. 

Tahira is a very hardworking and responsible woman. She does everything for her family. She applied for 1,500 AZN to buy fertilizers and increase her harvest. She knows that this will increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and increase her harvest.

loans.name: Safania's Group

texts.en:
Tumaini is a group of eight farmers who live in the Kakamega North District and have selected Safania as their Kiva representative. We see him on the right with his hand raised. We will deliver farming supplies to him and the 96 other individual farmers represented in this group. They will receive credit needed to plant one quarter acre of maize and one quarter acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 Kenyan shillings.	 

Safania is 74 years old and has been a farmer for 50 of those years. He works hard to provide for his 10 children. His neighbors know him as friendly, hardworking, and trustworthy. Apart from farming, he is also involved in his community in a men's group, a savings group, and a prayer group. He described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of the One Acre Fund and the other farmers in the group. He joined the fund in 2010 to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, and acquire fertilizer, hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family. Because he is an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. 

Safania has gotten more involved with the One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. His work has improved his life because he has more profits from his harvest, more training, and more support. He also was able to save money and feed his family. In the future, he hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school, buy a cow, and invest in a business. 

The One Acre Fund focuses on working with small farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Safania and the Tumaini Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of buying the seeds and fertilizer package from our fund, which continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from the fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives. Please note that there are four additional group leaders in this photo who will be working with the One Acre Fund but will not be a part of this Kiva loan. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seed and fertilizer for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and bags of rice  to expand her business.

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en:
These women are part of Biakoye Group and have an average age of 48 years and three children at home. They all live in traditional extended families in Teshie, Ghana. These women are neighbors who work by buying and selling porridge, charcoal, cooking utensils, kenkey (cooked maize paste) and second-hand clothing. After successfully repaying their previous loan, these women of the Biakoye Group are on their second loan.

Gladys is the woman standing second from the right in the photo. She intends to use this loan to buy a bale of bed sheets to sell to customers. She buys her supplies locally at the main market, and makes her sales to diverse clients of women and men in cash and often on credit. She hopes to make a very good monthly profit, which she will use for school fees. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of bed sheets to sell to customers.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 60-year-old woman from the town of Guindulman, Bohol. For 24 years now, she has been selling snack foods such as banana cue (deep-fried banana in caramelized sugar), biscuits and pancakes. This business gives her a monthly income of 3,000 PHP. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for food to sell like cooking oil, peanuts, chips, biscuits, candies, bananas and flour. 

Corazon hopes that in the future she can further expand her business, buy healthy meals and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, peanuts, chips, biscuits, candies, bananas and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetic chains and bracelets to expand her business.

loans.name: Drande

texts.en:
Drande has been photographed in front of her animals' stable; she wants to make some home repairs with the loan that she is applying for from Kiva lenders. Kindly note that she felt uncomfortable should the home was seen in the picture, due to the fact that the home was really in bad shape and her family’s living conditions were not that good either. 

Drande’s main activity is agriculture/livestock, yet she cultivates fodder mostly and sells it to villagers in her living area. She has also one milk cow and some sheep; she uses part of the raw milk for her family's daily needs and she sells the rest to some nearby dairy farms.

loans.use: to make repairs to their family home

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Née en 1981 à KANGARE, SALIMATA vit avec 1 enfant et son époux dans une  famille traditionnelle à KANGARE Région de Sikasso, République du Mali. 
SALIMATA  n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle  s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des parures : tissus, boucle d’oreille, bracelet, et parfums.   
SALIMATA est à son premier  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 10 pièces de tissus et 5 douzaines de boucle d’oreille. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandise à BAMAKO   et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, au marché  et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes.  
SALIMATA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans les activités d’achat vente des parures.
texts.en:
Born in 1981 in Kangare, Salimata lives with her husband and one child in a traditional family in Kangare, Sikasso, in the Republic of Mali. Salimata did not have the chance to progress through school; instead she became interested early on in business, notably the buying and selling of accessories: fabric, earnings, bracelets, and perfumes. 

Salimata is on her first loan with Soro Yiriwaso, which she will use to buy 10 lengths of fabric and five dozen earrings. She procures her merchandise in Bamako and makes her sales for cash and credit from home, at the market, and at surrounding market festivals to male and female customers. 

Salimata hopes to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which will be used to help her husband support their family's needs, pay back her loan, and to reinvest in her business of buying and selling accessories.

loans.use: to buy accessories

loans.name: Nikoll

texts.en:
Nikoll is a married father of three school-aged children whose profession is carpenter; he runs his own carpentry shop. He is asking for 200,000 Albanian LEK  from Kiva lenders, which will help him buy raw material for his carpentry.  The carpentry profession and shop has been inherited from his father, according to him. He makes doors and windows and also any type of furniture. 

Nikoll is busy with this practice and he’s become happy, according to him. In addition to this practice, just like almost every other villager he and his wife do agriculture/livestock. They plant frequently fodder, beans, onions and green veggies. Kindly note that Albanians eat lots of green veggies; they mainly cook them with meat or just boil and serve them with Albanian extra virgin olive oil and squeezed fresh lemon juice or grape vinegar.

loans.use: to buy raw material for his carpentry practice

loans.name: Mario Rene

texts.es: Don Mario, tiene 61 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, con quien reside en el municipio de San Pedro Sula junto a sus dos hijos. Don Mario siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, hace 10 años vende sandalias para damas al detalle, vende en su casa y ambulante. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de más sandalias de diferentes estilos para vender. Con las ganancias piensa ahorrar para comprar un vehículo para el negocio.
texts.en: Don Mario is 61 years old and lives in a common law marriage with his wife and his two children in the municipality of San Pedro Sula.  Don Mario has always been in the trade business.  He has been selling women sandals for the last ten years from his home and on the street.  The loan he is requesting is for 10,000 lempiras and will be invested in buying more sandals in different styles for sale.  With his earnings he plans to save to buy a vehicle for his business.

loans.use: To buy women sandals for sale.

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr:
A 38 ans, Mama est en couple avec ses enfants. En 2008, elle débute son petit commerce de vente de condiments. Elle habite Tokoin à Lomé, un quartier situé à la frontière Togo-Ghana. Régulière dans les différentes formations animées par l’équipe d’Assilassimé, elle est aussi remarquable par son attitude de vie en équipe.
Mama sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son stock par l’achat de 2 bidons d’huile, 1 carton de tomate conditionnée, 1 panier de tomate fraiche et 1 sac d’oignon ce qui la permettra d’éviter les ruptures du stock face à une clientèle qui s’augmente de jour en jour.
texts.en:
At 38 years old, Mama is in a relationship and has children. She lives in Tokoin in Lome, an area situated on the border of Togo and Ghana.

In 2008, she started her own small business selling condiments. 

Mama regularly participates in the different trainings offered by Assilassime, and she is has a great team attitude.

Mama is seeking this loan to increase her stock by buying two drums of oil, one box of tomato paste, one tray of fresh tomatoes, and one sac of onions, which will allow her to avoid gaps in her stock due to a growing number of customers.

loans.use: to buy two drums of vegetable oil, tomato paste, fresh tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de trois femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée en novembre 2009. Ce banc regroupe des membres qui habitent dans le  même quartier et ceux des alentours. La plupart des membres font le commerce.
Djiguene, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est veuve et a 8 enfants dont 5 filles. Elle fait comme activité le commerce de produits alimentaires.D'ailleurs avec le prêt elle compte acheter du riz; huile,  divers autres produits alimentaires.
Les bénéfices lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants en achetant des moutons et des bœufs qu'elle élève  pour les besoins de la famille. Elle va aussi renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group of three women makes up a part of the banc villageois which was created in November, 2009. This bank joins members who live in the same neighborhood and nearby areas. Most of the members work in commerce. 

Djiguene, standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 58 years old. She is a widow with eight children, of whom five are girls. Djiguene sells food products. With this loan she plans to buy rice, oil, and other food products. 

Earnings will allow her to improve the living conditions of her children by buying sheep and cows, which she can raise for the family. She is going to also strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy various food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar is a 34-year-old single man. He is a refugee and lives In IDP settlement with his parents. His father works as a driver to earn money for the family. 

The main source of the family’s income is growing vegetables. Vugar raises and sells greens, onions, potatoes, lettuce, and eggplant. He has farmed for 13 years and has good skills. His monthly income is 170 AZN.

There is a high demand for vegetables in Azerbaijan.  Vegetables are healthy and are used to cook national dishes. 

Vugar needs to increase his income because a refugee’s life is very hard and his current income doesn’t allow him to cover living expenses. He requests 1,100 AZN to buy fertilizer to yield a larger harvest.

loans.use: to buy quality fertilizer.

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Yeabu.  She is single and has 2 children who are 15 and 12 years old. 

In 2004, Yeabu established her business to sell provisions, juice, beer, and stout. She began her business because she wanted to save some money to give to her children during her retirement. 

She sells to the public and her business is located in the city center. She works 7 days a week, 10 hours each day. She would like 5,000,000 SLL to buy provisions, juice, and other beverages. She hopes that this loan will help her to develop her business and earn more profit. 

In the future, Yeabu plans to build a bigger store and make good use of every good thing that comes her way.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy provisions, juice, beer, and stout.

loans.name: Vilma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Vilma, opta por un nuevo crédito para adquirir mercadería por mayor y surtir bien su inventario con los productos que sus clientes buscan. Comprará cacerolas, ollas de loza, recipientes para comida, depositos para agua, guacales, platos, comales, jarras, etc.
Con el crédito anterior surtió bien su negocio lo que le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas, aumentar la clientela y mejorar sus condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
Vilma is requesting a new loan in order to buy merchandise at whole sale price and stock her inventory well with the products that her customers look for. She will buy pans, ceramic pots, food containers, water tanks, wooden crates, griddles, pitchers, etc. 

With the previous loan, she stocked her business well. This helped her to improve her sales, increase her clientele, and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pans, ceramic cooking pots, wooden crates, plates, griddles, pitchers, etc.

loans.name: Ahouansivi Ida

texts.fr:
Ida bénéficiaire des services d’ASSILASSIME est mariée, elle vit dans le quartier Nyekonakpoè à Lomé avec ses 3 enfants. En 2008, elle a débuté son petit commerce des œufs; elle s’approvisionnait auprès des semi-grossistes ce qui lui revenait plus cher et moins bénéfique. Elle est aussi employée en temps partiel avec un salaire qui ne lui permet pas de couvrir le mois.
Vaillante, Ida n’a jamais baissé les bras. Elle débute en 2013, la vente des compléments alimentaires, après avoir comprit l’importance de diversifier ses activités. Suite à la forte demande du produit, elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter un stock supplémentaire de 7 paquets de complément alimentaires JOYVA COFFEE.
texts.en:
Ida, an Assilassime client, is married and lives in the Nyekonakpoe neighborhood in Lome with her three children. 

In 2008, she started her own small business selling eggs. She was buying the eggs from semi-wholesalers, who sell the eggs at a more expensive rate.

She also is employed part time with a salary that does not allow her to cover her monthly costs.

Valliantly, Ida never stops. In 2013, she started selling food supplements, after having realized the importance of diversifying her business. Following a strong demand for the product, Ida is seeking a loan to buy an additional stock of 7 packets of food supplement Joyva coffee.

loans.use: to buy seven packs of Joyva coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice and palm oil.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
These people are part of an 8-member group called Ebenezer. They live in the same area and sell soft drinks, medicine, plantains, cassava, cloth, material, and kenkey (cooked maize paste).

Margaret is a wife and mother who sells material and cloth. She asks for 3,400 GHS to buy more material and cloth. She handles her family's daily expenses and supports her husband manage their expenses. She has more than 6 years experience in this business and is applying for her first loan with ID-Ghana. 

She works from 7 am until 8 pm.The group has received proper orientation about the loan and saving principals and  promise to utilize this loan judiciously.   

In the future, and with the help of the institution, she would like to expand her business and save money to improve the life of her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell more materials and cloth.

loans.name: Mirsvali

texts.en:
Mirsvali is a 55-year-old refugee. He is married and has two daughters and four sons. The family lives in IDP settlement and the main source of the family’s income is providing fodder. Mirsvali grows grass and sells hay.  He has good skills and his monthly income is 200 AZN. 

There is high demand for hay  to support the livestock industry. Farmers buy big haystacks for their livestock. Mirsvali supplies half of his haystacks to  big farms and keeps the remainder for his livestock. He fattens cows and then sells milk and meat too. This provides additional income for his family.

Although Mirsvali has a good job and loves it very much, his income is too low to cover his big family’s demands. He requests 1,100 AZN to buy good grass fertilizer. This will make grass more fresh and useful.

loans.use: to buy grass fertilizer.

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Uma.  She is married and has 3 children who are 25, 20 and 18 years old. 

In 2007, Uma started a business to sell curtains, laundry boards, and rubber products. She began her business because  it is the only income. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are the general public.  She works 7 days a week, 11 hours each day. 

She would like  5,000,000 SLL to buy bowls, buckets, and laundry boards. 

In the future, Uma plans to get another sales point, the loan will help me to make payment for another sales point as a result of increase in the profit. She is very wise and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic bolws, buckets, and laundry boards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale

loans.name: Jose Anibal

texts.es:
José Aníbal tiene 67 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Nuevo Oriente, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz, yucas, frejol entre otros, también cria ganado vacuno su esposa le apoya en esta labor ordeñando a el ganado lechero para posteriormente ofrecerlo la leche fresca y la elaboración de queso fresco, son una familia unida que esfuerza en la labor que realiza.

José Aníbal ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una vaca lechera y de esta manera vender la leche fresca a la empresa acopiadora de su distrito.
texts.en:
José Aníbal is 67 years old and lives with his wife and children in Caserío de Nuevo Oriente - a rural area of the Santo Tomás district. It is a community of varying climate. The population works in agriculture, business, and ranching. It is located in the Cutervo province which belongs to the Cajamarca region on the northern range of Perú. 

He works in agriculture - specifically growing corn, yuca, beans, and more. He also raises beef cattle. His wife helps him by milking the dairy cow to later sell the fresh milk and produce fresh cheese. They are a close-knit and hardworking family. 

José Aníbal has applied for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy a dairy cow so that he can sell the fresh milk to the distributing company in his district.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to sell fresh milk.

loans.name: Estefany Geraldine

texts.es:
Estefany es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, vive en la ciudad de imperial y cada día se esfuerza mucho para poder superarse, es por ello que trabaja en una pequeña empresa como operadora de atención al cliente y de esta manera puede tener ingresos  para solventar sus gastos.

Estefany está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá solventar algunos gastos personales y mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, de esta manera podrá seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de contabilidad”.
texts.en:
Estefany is a young woman with hopes of getting ahead. She lives in a city called Imperial. Every day she strives to better herself. As such, she works in a small business as a customer service agent. This way she has the income to cover her expenses. 

Estefany is very thankful for Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, she was able to cover certain personal expenses and improvements in her home. This way she can continue working and striving to be able to realize her biggest dream: to study for a career in accounting.

loans.use: to cover personal expenses and improve her home.

loans.name: Tane

texts.en: Tane, the widowed mother of six, is back again; she now needs your financial help again to install doors and windows in their family home.

loans.use: to install doors and windows in their family home

loans.name: Abibatu Z

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Abibatu.  She is married and has four children who are 10, 15, 28 and 30 years old. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to help with the house chores. 

In 2006, Abibatu established her pharmacy and clinic business. She began her business to be self reliant after graduating from nursing school and to help with the children's education. Her business is located in the outskirts of town and her main customers are pregnant women and children. 

She works 7 days a week,14 hours a day to earn 1,206,000 SLL each month. She would like 3,000,000 SLL. Abibatu has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans, and now requires a new loan to buy amoxcillin, novalgin, paracetamol and syringes. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve her stock and raise the profit. 

In the future, Abibatu plans to expand the business to a referral center, which is under construction. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for essential drugs for her business.

loans.name: Ozodakhon

texts.ru: Озодахон уроженка района Исфары Республики Таджикистана. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. Озодахон живет вместе с мужем и невесткой. Озодахон любит природу и борец за ее защиты. Вот уже на протяжении 6 лет она занимается земледелием. На данный момент она готовиться сажать новые плодородные деревья. Сейчас ей необходимы средства, на которые она собирается купить достаточное количество саженцев. Такая работа требует заботы и времени. Озодахоне помогает ее невестка, они вместе занимаются земледелием. Озодахон надеется с Вашей помощью во время закончить посев саженцев. Поддержите Озодахон.
texts.en: Ozodakhon is a native of the Isfara District in the Republic of Tajikistan. She is 48 years old and married. Ozodakhon lives with her husband and daughter-in-law. Ozodakhon loves nature and and is a crusader for its protection. For the last 6 years, she has practiced crop farming. She is currently getting ready to plant new fruit trees. Now she needs a certain amount of money, with which she plans to buy a good amount of seedlings. This kind of work requires a lot of time and attention. Ozodakhon is helped by her daughter-in-law. They practice crop farming together. Ozodakhon needs your help to finish sowing her seedlings on time. Please support Ozodakhon.

loans.use: to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Astor

texts.en: Astor rebuilt the damaged animal stable and now he is back and wants your financial help again. A loan in an amount of 250,000 Albanian lek will help him buy a dairy cow and fertilizers for his seedlings.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and fertilizers for the seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more waxed cotton for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil, and seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Atitecas Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Atitecas” is composed of seven Mayan-Tzutujiles who live in the highlands of Guatemala. They are motivated to sustain and expand their small businesses with the ultimate goal of creating better lives for themselves, their families and their community. The Trust Bank is on its first loan cycle and ladies are quite excited!

The seven women participate in monthly meetings with a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer who assist them with their loans. In addition, they participate in non-formal educational trainings that are given at each meeting to learn useful and relevant information that can be applied immediately to their business practices and their families. Examples of these themes include effective business management, budgeting and accounting as well as nutrition, health and medicinal plants. Other topics include women’s and children’s rights, self-esteem and leadership.

Because of the leadership skills that she has demonstrated, Dora is the 28-year-old President of the Trust Bank. She is married with three children. For many years, she has worked with her husband at their shoe store and offers their customers shoes for all ages and styles. They have an excellent location for their business which they rent in the center of the town. The couple is anxious to please their customers and because Easter Week is fast approaching, they anticipate increased business. Easter is a major holiday in Guatemala and it is often the time of the year when the population purchases new clothing and shoes. Dora wants to access increased capital so that she can meet the increased demands of her customers and so she is applying for a loan.

The members of the Trust Bank have recently learned about the kindness and generosity of KIVA investors in funding their small loans. The ladies share that with the investment in their businesses and the profits that they will hopefully realize, that their primary goals are to be able to give their children food, clothing and shelter. Their next very important goal is to be sure that their children are able to go to school because they realize that a good education is the key to a more successful and prosperous future. Education is not free in Guatemala and the parents work very hard so that their children can attend school.

Dora, along with the six other ladies of the “Atitecas” Trust Bank look forward to reporting back to KIVA investors on their progress. They have made a firm promise to successfully proceed through their first loan cycle and pay back the entire loan with punctual payments. They have 	taken the first step toward empowering themselves and leaving poverty behind! 

Thank you KIVA investors!

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Ajkay Group

texts.en:
Manuela is a member of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Ajkay” in Guatemala. She is 61 years of age, married, and has seven children. She works at her own food business during weekends in her own home. She sells typical Guatemalan appetizers including tostadas, tamales, and chuchitos that are like tamales made of corn, tomato sauce and meat. She also sells a hot corn beverage called “atole”. In spite of the fact that she is older, Manuela works hard and with her years of experience, she is able to make enough money to take care of her older husband, herself and her youngest son who is still in high school. She wants to see him graduate with a solid career and be able to access a good job. Manuela also wants her son to assist her with the administration of her business.

Manuela wants to secure a loan from Friendship Bridge to invest in her food business in order to increase the number of customers. She will use the funds to buy utensils and basic food items including grains because she wants to be sure that she has plenty of supplies when she is ready to make her delicious appetizers each weekend. 

The ladies of the Trust Bank “Ajkay” have various businesses that include textile production, animal husbandry and stores where items for daily consumption are sold. During the monthly meetings, they meet with a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer who assists them with their loan cycle that lasts for ten months. The women also receive non-formal education trainings on subjects like women’s rights, leadership and self-esteem, as well as business management, indebtedness and accounting. Other themes include health, nutrition and medicinal plants.

The women of the Trust Bank are very grateful to have access to small loans and education because they realize that these are real tools that they can use to empower themselves, their families and their community. They express their appreciation to KIVA investors for providing them with the necessary capital to make their goals and dreams come true!

loans.use: to buy utensils and basic food items including grains for ther food business.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Бизнес woman Адолат 46 лет, она любящая женщина, мама 19 летней девочки. Она живет вместе с дочерью на районе Исфара. Ее муж находиться зарубежьем на заработках как и большинство мужчин Республики Таджикистана. На протяжении 5 лет Адолат занимается продажей сухофруктов. На данный момент она хочет выкупить партию сухофруктов и продать на рынке. Так как сухофрукты сейчас очень востребованы. Адолат хочет получить кредит и приобрести больше товара и расширить малый бизнес. Надеемся, у нее все получится.
texts.en: Adolat is 46 years old and a businesswoman. She is a sweet woman and a mother to a 19-year-old daughter. She lives with her daughter in the Isfara District. Her husband is working abroad like the majority of men in the Republic of Tajikistan. For the past five years, Adolat has been selling dried fruit. She currently wants to buy a shipment of dried fruit and sell it at the market. Dried fruit is in high demand now. Adolat wants to receive a loan to buy more merchandise and expand her small business. She hopes that she is able to get a loan.

loans.use: to expand her small business of selling dried fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business

loans.name: Titik

texts.en:
Titik lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling groceries and mobile phone airtime credit. Titik is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Titik joined Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credit. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Titik sees improvements in her shop. For the last month, she has earned an average of $1 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase onions, cooking oil and Maggie to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  used shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies that will help her coffee plants.

loans.name: Velika

texts.en:
This is Velika, a 32-year-old mother of two little children who are ages two and one. Velika is an Egyptian from the vulnerable ethnics of Albania. She’s been photographed with her one-year-old child in the cradle. This cradle has been used in rural Albania for ages due to the fact that it made it easier for mothers or grandmothers to carry the child on their backs by tying the cradle with a rope. While they worked in the field, they kept the baby in the field too. Although things have changed in Albania, rural people still raise the children until they are one year old in the cradle.

Velika needs your financial help to prepare two dynyms land for planting beans. Note that ‘dynym’ is a unit of area used in the Ottoman Empire that is equal to 1000 square meters. Velika’s husband works as a welder and together they plant and sell the harvested products to the local farmer’s market.

loans.use: to prepare two dynyms of agricultural land for planting beans.

loans.name: Momokhol

texts.ru: Момохол милая женщина с открытой душой, любящая жена, мама и просто хороший человек, на которого можно положиться. Ей 29 лет. Маомохол из района Кубадиён. Она там же живет со своей семьей. В Кубадиёне прекрасная погода, свежий воздух, есть все условия для развития животноводства. И этим она хочет в дальнейшем заняться. Ей бы хотелось купить пару голов крупнорогатых скотов и от их доходов развить свой бизнес. Но только финансы не позволяют. И поэтому она просит в займы. Момохол верит в Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Momokhol is a lovely woman with an open heart, a beloved wife, a mother, and simply a good person you can trust in. She is 29 years old. Momokhol is from the Qubadiyon District. She lives there with her family. In Qubadiyon, the weather is wonderful and the air is fresh - it has all of the conditions for raising livestock. She wants to take up this business in the future. She would like to buy a pair of cattle and from their earnings, develop her business. However, her finances do not allow her to do that, which is why she is requesting a loan. Momokhol believes in your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to develop her livestock breeding business.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Musu from Waterloo, in the western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children.  She began this business to be independent and take care of her family.  

Musu runs a charcoal retail business. She has run this business for 5 years and works 8 hours per day and 7 days per week. Musu says that the main challenge to her business is poor roads  within her operation area.

Musu requests a loan to purchase charcoal to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo, in the  western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children.  She began this business to be  independent and take care of her family.  

Fatmata runs a retail business to sell pillows. She has run this business for 10 years and works 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. Fatmata says that her business is doing fine.

Fatmata requests a loan  to purchase more pillows to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. 

She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more pillows to expand her business.

loans.name: Tumiran

texts.en:
Tumiran lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling snacks, groceries, mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Tumiran is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Tumiran joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credit. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Tumiran sees improvements in his shop. For the last month, he has earned an average of $1 - $2 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel vive en la ciudad de Pisco, vive al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijos a los cuales quiere muchísimo y por quienes se esfuerza para poder darles lo mejor; es por ello que Miguel desde hace 5 años trabaja como pescador, especialmente como tripulante de una pequeña embarcación de pesca, lo cual le permite poder tener ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hogar.
