Miguel está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá comprar los útiles escolares para sus menores hijos y de esta manera ellos puedan ir a la escuela sin ningún problema y de esta manera sigan estudiando, así Miguel seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un trabajo estable y seguro”.
texts.en: Miguel lives in a city called Pisco. He lives with his wife and their two children whom he loves very much. It is for them that he works hard to be able to give them the best. For this reason, Miguel has worked for five years as a fisherman. He specifically works as a crewman of a small fishing boat. This allows him to make enough income to cover living expenses. Miguel is very thankful for Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, he was able to buy school supplies for his young children so that they can go to school without problem and continue studying. Miguel will continue working to be able to fulfill his biggest dream: to have a safe and stable job.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A portion of Rebwar's Group $ 3,600 loan is to purchase wooden support poles.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, tiene una familia que está integrada por su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos, como toda una madre responsable y en busca de ofrecer un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos inicio su negocio en el que ofrece a sus clientes refrescos, choco bananos, hielo y charamuscas, lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, su horario de atención es de 7:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m., ya posee mucha experiencia en el negocio por lo que no representa riesgos.
El crédito que está solicitando lo utilizara para comprar azúcar, bolsas, chocolate, guineos, entre otros materiales para elaborar la venta, le será de ayuda para incrementar su producción, aumentar sus clientes, mejorar sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos.
Su sueño es contar con los recursos económicos que le permitan mejorar su vivienda y ofrecer a sus hijos una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Maria has a family made up of her partner and their four children. As a responsible mother, she is searching for the best lifestyle for her children. 

She started her business, where she offers her clients sodas, chocolate bananas, ice and popsicles, and learned it through her own initiative. Her operating hours are 7 a.m. to 8 p.m., and she already has a lot of experience with the business, so she poses no risk.

She will use the loan she's asking for to buy sugar, bags, chocolate, bananas, etc. among other materials to develop sales. They will be helpful in increasing her production, increasing her customers, improving her sales and having better income.

Her dream is to have the economic resources to allow her to improve her life and offer her children a university career.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bags, chocolate, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Jose Lucas

texts.es:
José, manifiesta que su negocio tiene más clientes, mejores ventas y sus nuevos ingresos le permitieron cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas y mejorar un poco las circunstancias familiares, pues con el crédito anterior logro una buena cosecha, surtir su taller de bicicletas con repuestos necesarios para ofrecer un buen servicio.
En esta oportunidad solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes, pedales, frenos, llantas, parches y pago de mano de obra para cultivar, para fortalecer más su negocio y continuar mejorando su economía.
texts.en: José reveals that his business has more customers, better sales, and additional income which allow him to make timely loan installments and improve some of his family circumstances. The previous loan brought forth a better harvest and stocked his bicycle shop with spare parts needed to provide good service. Now, he is applying for a new loan to buy manure, insecticides, fertilizers, pedals, brakes, wheels, tire patches, and manual farm labor. This will further strengthen his business so he can continue improving his finances.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticides, fertilizers, pedals, brakes, tires, tire patches, and manual farm labor.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Elizabeth from Waterloo, in the Western rural in Freetown. She is married with 3 children, all attend school.

For the past 7 years, Elizabeth has had a cooking business. She began her business because she wants to generate income to take care of her family. She works 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems within her operation area.

Elizabeth requires a loan to purchase  cooking oil,  rice and seasoning to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business.

In the future, Elizabeth plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice, and seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Cecillia     B

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Cecillia from Tombo, in western rural Freetown. She is married with 2 children.  After she left school, Cecillia established her cooking business. She began her business because she wants to support her daily living. She works 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is during the rainy season because sales are very slow.

Cecillia requires a loan to purchase cooking oil, rice and seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Cecillia plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchasing cooking oil, rice and seasonings expand her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is a 38-year-old married woman from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She has 4 children between the ages of 5  and 15 years old. Her children  attend school. After she got married, Kadiatu established a business to sell slippers. She began her business because she wants to create a permanent source of income to support her children. She works  8 hours per day and 6 days per week. She says that  her business is doing well.

Kadiatu requires a loan to purchase more slippers. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kadiatu, she is in her early forties, from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown.  She is married with 3 children.  For 20 years, Kadiatu established her food stand business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to expand her business, and transportation.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to earn a degree in accounting.

loans.name: Hilda Maria

texts.es:
Hilda María tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una bodeguita donde ofrece venta de productos de primera necesidad y productos de belleza, sus clientes son sus vecinos y moradores de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 600 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos de primera necesidad azúcar, menestras, arroz, cereales, harina, leche huevos entre otros para hacer crecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Hilda María is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the Cayaltí district - a community of varying climate. Her people work in agriculture, sales, and ranching. It is located in the Chiclayo province which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. 

She owns a small store that sells food staples and beauty products. Her customers are her neighbors and district residents. 

She has applied for a loan of 3,600 nuevos soles to buy a variety of food staples such as sugar, beans, rice, grains, flour, milk, eggs and more. This will grow her business so that she can make more profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food staples to grow her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is a 39 year old woman from the town of Cortes, Bohol. She is married with 3 children aged 9, 10 and 13.  Her husband works as a driver to support their family. Cristina runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells various commodities like chips, biscuits, soap and canned goods. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs to earn additional income. Both her businesses started 4 years ago. She is asking for a loan which she hopes will help her to meet the family's daily needs. She will use the money to buy pig feed and additional piglets, and also as additional capital for a barbecue vending business. In the future, she hopes to expand her businesses and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to support her hog-raising business and her barbecue vending business.

loans.name: Qazim

texts.en:
Qazim, a married father of two, is a 56-year-old fisherman who has been photographed with fishing nets at his jobsite. Not only does Qazim fish for a living, but he also does agriculture; he plants wheat and has grapevines. 

He wants to buy nets and prepare the soil for planting, and a loan in an amount of 250,000 Albanian Lek will help him achieve his goal. 

Qazim fishes at Lake Ohrid, which straddles the mountainous border between southwestern Macedonia and eastern Albania. This lake is one of Europe's deepest and oldest lakes, preserving a unique aquatic ecosystem that is of worldwide importance, with more than 200 endemic species. Declared a World Heritage site by UNESCO, the towns situated at the lakeside are Pogradec in Albania, along with Ohrid and Struga in Macedonia.

The two fish that are widely found in this lake are the brown trout that tastes like the Atlantic salmon, and another one that is grown only in this lake, called Koran. Fishermen have their own primitive boats and nets to fish; alongside the national road of Tirana-Korca you can see lots of fishermen and their sons selling their fresh fish, or some little fish called in the local language ‘Cironka’, to drivers and passengers.

loans.use: to buy new nets for fishing and prepare the soil for planting

loans.name: Rokidin

texts.en:
Rokidin runs a small stall where he sells mobile phone airtime credits and processes bill payments. He lives in Indramayu, a semi-urban area about six hours from Jakarta. Rokidin is married.

Rokidin began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business. For the last month, he has had around $150 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

He took a loan for getting a printer from Kiva to support his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to buy a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Mubarak

texts.en:
Mubarak is a 48-year-old refugee. He is married and has a daughter and two sons. His wife is a housekeeper and they live in an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) settlement.  Mubarak is a farmer. He has been raising seasonal vegetables (cucumbers, onions, potatoes, lettuce and eggplant) and selling them at the local bazaar. He gets 220 AZN monthly and has a good experience in this field. 

Azerbaijan cuisine is various and rich. There are different ancient recipes of delicious dishes from vegetables. People use vegetables to cook badimjhan dolmasi, dovgha, kuku, pomidor dolmasi, etc. They prepare these dishes for dinner or for parties. That’s why there is a high demand for fresh vegetables. 

Mubarak’s income doesn’t cover his family’s demands. It’s hard for a refugee to pay life's costs and maintain a family. Mubarak wants to provide his children with a good education and a good future. He applied for 1,100 AZN in order to supply and raise fruit trees. This will expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to supply and raise fruit trees

loans.name: Beda

texts.en: Beda is a 42-year-old woman from the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is married but has no children. She is currently engaged in food vending and raising hogs to earn an income. Beda wants to improve her business and needs additional capital for this purpose. She is asking for a loan to buy flour and sugar, as well as feed for her hogs. She hopes that the loan will pave the way for a better return on her investment, and fattened hogs that she can market at a good price in four months.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar, as well as feed for her hogs

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en: Dionisia is a 54-year-old woman from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is married with four children aged 10 to 35. Since getting married, she has been engaged in running a sari-sari (general) store selling basic household commodities. She is asking for a loan to buy candy, chips, canned goods, cooking oil, seasoning, sugar, coffee, body soap and shampoo. Dionisia hopes to increase her inventory and eventually offer merchandise that she has not previously carried to attract more customers. In the future, she dreams of seeing her children successful with their lives.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Adama.  She is married and has six children. 

In 2008, Adama established her drinks and provisions business. She began her business because things were very difficult when she was a housewife, so she decided to go into business with some small capital given to her by her husband.   With the help of the business, she can assist him in other responsibilities at home. 

Her business is located in the outskirts, and her main customers are the public.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she gets support from her husband every month.  

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more crates of drinks and cartons of provisions, like milk, sugar, mayonnaise, sardines, etc. 

She hopes that this loan will help the business grow, and increase the profit. 

In the future, Adama plans to open another outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of drinks and cartons of provisions

loans.name: Alde

texts.en: Alde is 63 years old and is from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is married with three adult children. She and her husband work together to meet their basic needs like buying food and paying the bills. She helps in farming rice and coconuts. She also raises hogs to earn additional income. This business started since she got married. Alde is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy feed and fertilizer. In four months time, she hopes to have an abundant harvest of rice and fattened hogs that she can sell at a profit.

loans.use: to buy feed and fertilizer
